Her business is located at a busy market in a residential area called Mukuru Kwa Njenga. Irene is served by the Kitengela Branch. She provides milling services to the local people. She also mills her own maize and other cereals into flour which she sells to the local people. She has been in doing this business for the last two years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is travelling long distances in search of cereals. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She has a dream of acquiring a bigger 'posho' (cornmeal) milling machine which can make a whole sack of flour in a short period of time. She describes herself as hardworking, independent, reliable and focused.

loans.use: buying beans, maize to grind and sell

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima comes fron a small city in Pakistan called Kasur, famous in Pakistan for its leather industry. She is a resident of Basti Laal Shah which is a small housing colony in Kasur. She moved here with her husband and children 5 years ago. She is married to M. J. and has given birth to 5 children, 2 sons and 3 daughters. None of them has been able to get an education due to poor financial conditions. 

Saima herself is supporting her family financially from her embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses for orders which she receives from different boutiques and cloth shops.  She receives good earning after completing the orders on time. Her earning allows her to pay the utilities expenses of her family. 

Her husband is a painter by trade and paints walls, windows and doors to order. People hire him for painting their houses. He gets work on a contract basis. Most of the time, he is hired by construction companies. He also runs a dairy business from his home. He has some buffaloes at his home from which he gets milk to sell for extra income. His dairy business helps him when he doesn’t get any orders from the other clients.
  
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her embroidery business. With the loan amount she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread, sketches and cloth in bulk quantity for her embroidery business. With the bulk items she can offer more quality of work to her customers and make good profit. She is a new loan user of Asasah and is hopeful that this loan will earn her good profits. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Saima.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour and some shop items to sell.  Sarah is 37 years old and married to a chief. She has two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a small agricultural farm.

loans.use: To stock baking flour and some shop items to sell

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia lives in a small city of Punjab called Kausr, famous in Pakistan for its leather industry. She is 27 years old, divorced and doesn’t have children. She lives in a three-room brick house with her brothers. She keeps herself busy making embroidered clothes for her neighboring clients. She is a skillful lady. She knows different embroidery techniques and applies those techniques on clothes to give them a new look.  She receives regular orders due to the quality of work. Both her brothers adopted the embroidery work as a profession just like their sister Rabia. They have their own shop in the market where they receive regular orders and complete embroidered dresses to earn their income.  

Rabia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, sketches and colored thread in bulk and makes embroidered dresses to sell to different shops to earn a living. She is a new client of Asasah and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Rabia.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items in bulk quantity

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane O. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell. Jane is 45 years old and is widowed.  She has 1 child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy domestic animals and keep them at home.

loans.use: To stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is currently in the business of selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. Betty is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a tax collector. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Одил проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Сейчас клиент предоставляет услугу, такси. Развозит людей с одного места на другое. Год как он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Odil A. lives in Hamadoni. He is thirty years old, married, and has three children. He has a high school education. The client runs a taxi service. He carries people from one place to another. He has been doing this for a year. He is taking out a loan to repair his automobile.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Margaret  Wamaitha

texts.en:
Margaret Wamaitha is 24 years and married. David Kabiru, her husband, is 27 years old. He is a truck driver and they have one child who is three years old. Margaret has been in the business of poultry farming as a primary business and operates a green grocer's as her secondary business. She has been doing this business for one year with an income of KES 8,000 per month.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by another existing client and she is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 to add to the savings she has made from both of her businesses. She wants to buy a dairy cow to rear for milk production. This will improve her farming activity and boost her income. All these activities she does at Kimuga in Kiambu, her rural area near the banana open air market, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city. She sells her products mostly to her neighbors and she takes some products to the nearby open air market.

Margaret plans to use the extra profit to build a modern house for her family, and offer good education to her child to university level, she is a very hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to rear for milk production.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta G. is currently in the business of selling ladies' dresses, radios and bags and is requesting a loan to stock more bags to sell. Besta is 25 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house and to buy goats.

loans.use: To stock more bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina U. is currently in the business of selling fish, beans. etc.  She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Regina is 32 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some cows to rear.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.ar: نضال شاب مكافح ونشيط، يبلغ 33 عاماً، متزوج وله ولدين. يعمل في مجال صناعة الحجر الصخري الصناعي منذ 14 سنة، ولكنه يعمل لحسابه الخاص منذ 2008. واجه نضال مشاكل عند بداية العمل لحسابه الخاص، منها عدم معرفة الزبائن له، بالإضافة إلى قلة خبرته في البداية ولكن الوضع تغيير الآن وثقة الزبائن به تطورت. حبه للعمل في مجال الحجر وإتقانه لهذه المصلحة، هو ما خوله إمتلاك عمل خاص. تقدم نضال بطلب قرض من الجمعية اللبنانية للتنمية-المجموعة، وذلك بهدف شراء قوالب جديدة لصب الحجر الصخري الصناعي، ولتكملة بناء المعمل. يهدف نضال إلى تكبير المصلحة، وتوسيع المعمل
texts.en: Nidal is a hard-working and active young man. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. He has been working in the business of stone cutting for the past 14 years, but only started own business in 2008. At first Nidal encountered difficulties such as not being known by customers and his limited experience. Things have, however, started to change and he is gaining customers’ trust. His passion for the stone craft and his good experience are what have made it possible for him to have his own business. Nidal submitted a request for a loan from the Lebanese Association for Development, Al-Majmoua, in order to purchase new casts for industrial stone molding, as well as to complete the construction of his workshop. Nidal aims to expand his business and enlarge his workshop.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business and to complete building his workshop

loans.name: Arkan

texts.ar: يبلغ اركان  من العمر 32 عاماً، متزوج، وهو يبيع المحروقات والزيوت للمنازل والأفران والمعامل في منطقة عالية. هذه هي المرة الأولى التي يطلب فيها اركان قرض من المجموعة وذلك بهدف شراء محروقات لتقوية المصلحة، بالإضافة إلى بيك أب (PICKUP) صغير للمصلحة. يعمل اركان لحسابه الخاص. من أهم المشاكل التي كانت تواجهه في البدء هي عدم معرفة الزبائن به، ولكن حبه لعمله وثقة الزبائن بخبرته، بعد تجربة نوعية بضاعته كانت نقطة قوته بحيث أن التعامل معه أكسبه رأس مال قوي، مكنه من شراء كم جيد من البضاعة. يحلم اركان بإمتلاك محطة محروقات كبيرة.
texts.en: Arkan is a 32-year-old married man. He sells fuel and oil products to households, bakeries, and laboratories in the Aley area of Lebanon. This is Arkan’s first loan request from Al Majmoua. The loan will help him purchase fuel and expand his activity. Arkan will also use this loan to purchase a small pick-up truck for his business, of which he is the sole proprietor. At the beginning, one of the most difficult challenges facing Arkan was building a clientele, but his love for his job and his customers’ faith in his experience, after having tried his products, was his strong point. Arkan managed to earn good capital, allowing him to purchase a sufficient amount of goods. In the future, he aspires to own a large fuel station.

loans.use: To purchase fuel products and expand his work, and to buy a small pickup truck for his business-

loans.name: Saina

texts.en:
Saina is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 8 years. Her farm produces vegetables, maize, and beans which she sells locally. She also earns income from the sale of bricks in the local market. Saina is 43 years old and married with five children between 11 and 22. Four of them are currently attending school. 

She recently repaid her fourth loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 41,600KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the income from this loan will improve her family's livelihood. In future, she would like to purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production. She faces the challenge of fluctuation in market prices and changes in climatic conditions. She is happy that Juhudi has empowered her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables, maize and beans which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family. Rose is 35 years old and married with six children between 16 and six months. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested this loan of 60,000KES to start a poultry project. She says her family will be able to live a better life and also see her children through school with the income from this project. The prevailing low market prices are a major setback for her. In five years' time, she hopes to have acquired two quality dairy cows so that she can diversify her source of income.

loans.use: To start  a poultry project.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille was born in 1976. She is married with four children and she takes care of one dependent. Dancille is a busineswoman and her husband is a farmer. Even though they have different occupations, they work hard for the profits for their family. Dancille owns a small business selling various products such as juice, biscuits, cosmetic products and so on. Dancille has been in this field since 2008. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Dancille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more products to sell in her store. This expansion will make her more effective, more efficient and more successful.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Merwan

texts.ar: مروان رجل متزوج وله ثلاثة أولاد يبلغ 44 سنة، يعمل في مجال الميكانيك منذ عشر سنوات، وهو معروف جداً في منطقة عاليه. زبائنه هم أبناء المنطقة، الأقارب والأصدقاء. تقدم مروان لأول مرة بطلب قرض من المجموعة، بهدف المساعدة في تكملة سداد الأقساط المدرسية الباهظة في المنطقة، بالإضافة إلى تجديد بعض المعدات اليدوية في مصلحته. خبرته في تصليح السيارات باتت شائعة في المنطقة، مما يساعد على تقويته امام منافسة الآخرين من هذا المجال. يهدف مروان إلى التوسع في المصلحة، من خلال إدخال الصيانة الكهربائية والإلكترونية، بالإضافة إلى غيار الزيت على مصلحته
texts.en: Merwan is a 44-year-old husband and father of three who has worked as a mechanic for the past decade. His customers comprise relatives, friends, and others from the Aley district, where he is well-known and stands out from other competitors thanks to his formidable auto-repair skills. In addition to paying off excessive schooling debts, Merwan is applying for his first loan from Al-Majmoua in order to update some of the manual equipment in his workshop as well as to expand his business by adding electrical maintenance and oil-changing to his repertoire.

loans.use: Pay off school tuition, update equipment in work shop, expand services into electrical maintenance and oil changing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for the last 20 years. Her mixed farm produces maize, vegetables and potatoes which she sells locally. She also depends on the salary of her husband who is employed as a teacher to cater for the needs of her family. She is 46 years old and married with 7 children who are between the ages of 5 and 27. Six of the children are currently attending school.

Agnes has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 57,200KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that the income from this loan will help her in paying school fees for her children and improving their livelihood. She says that the cost of production is a major challenge compounded with poor prices of milk. She however hopes to expand her business and have a full zero-grazing unit with 4 stall-fed animals in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Affi Rose

texts.fr: M. Affi Rose est née le 23 Décembre 1971 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à YEHOUENOU Expédit, Rose est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Rose et sa famille vivent à Hêdomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis environs onze ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Rose n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Rose mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (allumettes, lait, sucre, pâtes alimentaires, savons, conserves de tomate, cubes, etc.)à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Rose vend de l'igname frit et des beignets de haricot. Rose achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rose exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Rose s'agrandit de plus en plus et Rose désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle. C'est donc pour augmenter son fonds de roulement que Rose sollicite pour une troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Affi Rose M. was born on December 23, 1971 in Ouidah, a historical city in Benin. Married to Expédit Yehouenou, Rose has four children, all of whom go to school. Rose has  been living with her family in Hedomey, in the community of Abomey Caliv, for about 11 years. The couple take care of the family expenses jointly. Rose has not been in school. In order to support herself and her children, Rose sells various general products (matches, milk, sugar, pasta, soap, canned tomatoes, bouillon cubes, etc) out of her home. As a secondary activity, Rose sells fried yams and bean fritters. Rose stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for five years and already obtained two loans,  both   properly repaid. Rose’s customer base keeps growing, and Rose would like to expand her business and better respond to various requests of her customers. In order to bolster her operating capital she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing various general products and bags of beans, yams, and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and upgrade her poultry farm.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for the last sixteen years. His mixed farm produces maize, beans and sugarcane which he sells locally. He is also a pastor in the same region. Ayub is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. 

He recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 61,200KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and keep poultry. He says the extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. His major challenge is poor prices for his products. In five years time, he hopes that his poultry farm will have expanded and that he will be the major supplier of eggs and poultry to the local market.

.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow, and keep poultry.

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot has been operating his mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya for the last six years. He has employed one person from his community to help on the farm. His farm produces tea, milk and pineapples, which he sells locally. He is 32 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 11. His eldest child attends school.

Cheruiyot has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 50,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the extra income from this loan will help him venture into other businesses and improve the livelihood of his family. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough funds to expand his farming activities. He would like to practice large-scale dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ossama

texts.ar: اسامه سيدة متزوجة تبلغ الخامسة والعشرون من العمر، لديها ولد واحد. تملك أسامة محل لبيع وتنسيق الازهارمنذ سنة ونصف. سبق لاسامة ان تعاملت مع المجموعة، وكان للقرض تاثير جيد على حياتها وعلى المستوى المعيشي لعائلتها، فقد ساعد على التوسع ةالإعتماد على النفس. ما يمييز عمل أسامة أنه متكامل وتفتح 24 ساعة، لتلبية حاجات ورغبات الأجناس المختلفة. فهي تلتزم تزيين الاعراس والسيارات، وتتمييز بذوقها الرفيع. زبائنها هم سكان المنطقة، أصحاب الفنادق والمطاعم، متعهدي الأفراح، بالإضافة إلى السياح. المشاكل التي واجهتها في بداية عملها هو عدم مصداقية التعامل من قبل الزيائن، ولكن إصرارها على النجاح ومثابرتها عليه أوصلها إلى ذروة النجاح. هذه المرة عمدت اسامه إلى طلب قرض من المجموعة لشراء كمية من الازهار الموسمية، بالإضافة إلى ستاندات أو رفوف لعرض البضائع بشكل احلى. تحلم وتصر اسامة على إنشاء مكتب تعهدات وإلتزام الأفراح.
texts.en: Ossama is a 25-year-old wife and mother of one who has for the last year-and-a-half been the owner of a florist shop. The last loan which Ossama received from Al-Majmoua improved the standard of living for her and her family by helping her expand her business and become more self-reliant. The applicant’s shop is distinguished by its owner’s exquisite taste as well as its 24-hour services ready to meet anyone’s needs. Among the larger orders the applicant fills are those for wedding flowers and decorating wedding caravans with flowers. The applicant’s patrons come from the general area and include hotel and restaurant owners, wedding providers, and tourists. The biggest obstacle which Ossama faced at the outset of her work was lack of name recognition, but her persistence has conveyed her to the peak of success. The applicant is now asking for a loan of $1500 to purchase seasonal flowers as well as stands and shelves to more aesthetically showcase her products. Ossama also hopes to eventually establish a wedding providing agency.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal flowers and stands and shelves to showcase products

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: D. Geneviève est née le 14 Mai 1977 à Athiémé et est mariée à AMEGNIKOU Daniel, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre représentent leurs propres enfants. Il y a environs neuf ans que la famille s'est installée à Hêdomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Geneviève vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille. Geneviève n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses charges, Geneviève prépare de la nourriture (haricot accompagné de farine de manioc) qu'elle vend à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Geneviève vend de liqueur. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Adja au Mono, que Geneviève s'approvisionne. Geneviève exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Geneviève désire augmenter son stock de produits et agrandir son activité ; raison pour laquelle Geneviève sollicite un troisième crédit. Geneviève désire plus tard vendre également des sacs de haricot.
texts.en:
Genevieve D. was born May 14, 1977 in Athiémé. She is married to Daniel AMEGNIKOU, a driver. The couple has five dependent children, four of which are their own children. About nine years ago, the family moved to Hêdomey in the town of Abomey Calavi. Genevieve helps her husband to provide for the family. Genevieve did not attend school. To meet the family’s expenses, she prepares dishes (beans with cassava flour) that she sells from her home. As a sideline, Genevieve also sells liquor. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Adja, located in Mono. Genevieve has been in this business for five years and has already obtained two loans, which were fully repaid. With customer demand increasing steadily, Genevieve wishes to stock up on supplies and expand her business. This is why she is seeking a third loan. In the future, she would also like to sell bags of beans.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 6 bags of beans, 3 sacks of cassava flour and 5 cans of liquor

loans.name: Salam

texts.ar: سلام رجل متزوج يبلغ من العمر 32 عاماً اب لولدين، يعمل نجار منذ عشر سنوات. سبق لسلام ان تعامل لمدة عامين مع المجموعة، وكان تاريخه الإقتراضي جيد جداً. بالإضافة إلى ان للقرض كان تأثير جيد على إنتاجية العمل وتحسين الوضع العائلي، وزيادة السيولة النقدية لديه. مصداقيته وضميره في العمل هما ورقته الرابحة امام المنافسين. يتقدم سلام بطلب قرض من المجموعة، وذلك لشراء عدة جديدة وحديثة الطراز لتسهيل عمله، بالإضافة إلى كمبراسور هواء (AIR COMPRESSOR). يامل سلام ذات يوم إنشاء عمل متكامل متطور.
texts.en: Salam is a 32-year-old husband and father of two who has been working as a carpenter for the last ten years. Salam enjoys a very good credit history with A. Majmoua, having previously worked with the institution over a two-year period. The last loan significantly increased the productivity of his work and the liquidity of his assets, overall improving his family situation. It is his credibility and scrupulousness which have given him an edge over his competitors. Salam is now applying for a loan to purchase up-to-date equipment as well as an air compressor to mitigate his workload and to further his goA. of developing a more integrated and advanced work operation.

loans.use: Purchase up-to-date equipment and an air compressor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand and progress her business.

loans.name: Paul  Waweru

texts.en:
Paul Waweru G. is a single hardworking man. He is 25 years old and has operated an entertainment pool table within Gitaru area for about eight years now. He makes a profit of KES 28,000 per month. He runs a barber shop as a primary business and, at same time, he manages the pool table as the secondary a source of income. This helps him to get more clients for the barber shop business. His business is situated at a very busy place where most of his customers are middle class in Gitaru, Kikuyu, Kenya.

He had borrowed from another financial institution called NDETIKA, and he was introduced to KADET LTD by his current group chairman. He is applying for his first loan. He intends to use the loan to expand his business by buying another pool table and to add another shaving machine. 

In future he hopes to expand the business to enable him to become a distributor of pool tables in Kikuyu and its environs.

loans.use: To buy another pool table and to add a shaving machine for his barber shop.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 40 year-old Hassan. He is married, and has 6 children aged 15,12,10,7,5 and 3. He has 5 additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives. In 1991, Hassan established his cosmetics business. He began his business because he felt he should be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,190,200 every month from this business. He needs a loan of SLL4,000,000. Hassan requires a loan to buy various cosmetics for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 438,040. In the future, Hassan plans to open another cosmetics shop and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Sarah  Njoki

texts.en:
Sarah Njoki has been farming for 15 years in Kambaa village in Kiambu. She is 40 years old and married to Stephen Kiguru,  a farmer. They have three school-going children. She gets an income of KES 7,000 per month out of the farming activity. She is also earns some additional income from casual employment. 

Sarah had borrowed from another MFI [PAWDEP] and repaid that loan well. Later she happened to get information about what KADET LTD. offers and she gained interest and applied for her first loan of KES10,000. She plans to buy a young rabbit for rearing and sell later, at a profit. She sells her farm products to her neighbors and also at the nearby local open air market. She also sells milk to the dairy societies and horticulture traders from Nairobi.

She plans to save the profit she gets and later buy another dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to university level. She is a very humble and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy a young rabbit for rearing and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Kadie. She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 14. She has three additional dependents who live with her because she is assisting them with their education.  

In the year 2000, Kadie established her cotton, lace and linens business. She began her business with the aim of generating enough income to educate her children. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,278,800 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Kadie has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional material. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 455,760SLL. 

In the future, Kadie plans to expand her shop and to educate her children up to the university level. Her business is popular because of the availability of the goods her customers desire at all times. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional material

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina A. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, a food vending business and charcoal sales. She lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various business activities, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Virgina is borrowing 16,000 PHP in this loan cycle so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Virgina hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and selling rice. Her husband, Romy C., who is 37 years old, works as a furniture maker to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business. They have two children, who are 10 and 13 years old and currently going to school. Vevencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Vevencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She plans to continue to save up for the future education of her children while supporting their daily needs. Vevencia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Abishyizhamwe No 10 Group

texts.fr:
Florien Harindintwali, naquit à Ruhuha  l’Est du Rwanda, elle a 45 ans, il est marié et il a 7 enfants, son ainé a 22 ans et son cadet a 6 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha-Bugesera. 5 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABISHYIZEHAMWE NO 10,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Florien et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un deuxième prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les felitilisants de leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Florien Harindintwali, 45 years old, was born in Ruhuha, East province of Rwanda. He is married with seven children; his eldest son is 22 and his youngest is 5. He finished primary school. He lives with is family in Ruhuha-Bugesera. Five of his children go to school.

He belongs to a solidarity group named Abishyizehamwe No.10; the group members are rice farmers and guarantee each other’s loan. Florien and his group work in order to support their families, improving their life conditions and paying school fees for their children. The group has taken out a second loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to purchase fertilizers for their field. After harvesting, one part of the produce is sold and the other used by the families.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita M. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: fishing, fattening pigs and selling food. She lives in Prk. Tuboran, Brgy. Caghagan, Sipalay, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing, pig fattening and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Rosita is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 22,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Rosita hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For the purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramon V., es del Asentamiento Maracana 2do.  Encuadre, es casado, tiene casa propia. 
El señor es propietario de una despensa bien surtida en su propio domicilio, según el que empezo con una pequeña casilla y siempre soñaba en tener una despensa como la que tiene ahora, gracias a su honestidad y a su responsabilidad que le caracteriza. 
Según el empezo con una pequeña casilla donde vendia empanada, milanesa y bebidas en gral.
Tambien se dedica a la agricultura, tiene buen ingreso mensuales posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales. 
Actualmente lucha para tener un local comercial mas grande para cargar mas su negocio asi  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como harina, fideos, yerba, jabones, y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramon V. is from Asentamiento Maracana 2do. Encuadre. He’s married and owns his house. He has a well stocked grocery store set up in his home. According to him, he started out with a small stand and always dreamed with having a store like the one which he now has thanks to the honesty and responsibility that he is noted for. According to him, he started out selling turnovers, breaded fried and assorted beverages from a small stand. He also does some farming. He earns good monthly income and has good personal and commercial references. He is currently striving to have a larger store so that he can stock more items and satisfy customer demand. He is asking for funds to buy merchandise like: flour, noodles, tea, soap and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a married woman who lives in Zone 10, Bacuyangan, Hinobaan, Neg. oCC. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  rice retailing and a scrap recycling businesses. Her husband, Bonifacio M., who is 48 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have 14 children who are 5 to 24 years old. Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000. She intends to purchase unmilled rice grains to dry, process and resell so that she can continue to save up to send their children into school to finish their studies. Nenita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Nenita is shown in the accompanying picture with the rice grains she is sun-drying before she sends it to the rice mill for processing.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is 34 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is 7 years old, the next is 4 years, and the last one is 7 months of age. Aimee's husband works in a beauty salon. 

Aimee owns a business selling food. Her business is profitable. She has four years of experience. She works from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Aimee is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more food. With her business expansion, Aimee will be able to change her life conditions and provide the necessities for her family.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items, rubber containers and suitcases in large quantities.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Agnes struggles to sell a small quantity of goods in her small shop. She sells only a few goods in her shop, such as body lotion and salt. She has owned this shop since 2005. Her business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Although Agnes has been in this business for about 5 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business by adding a large quantity of food, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flours, cosmetic goods, drinks, etc.  If successful, Agnes will hopefully earn more profits than she has been and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: A variety of goods, such as food, cosmetics, and drinks

loans.name: Aurore

texts.en:
Aurore was born in 1984. She is married and has a 1-1/2-year-old child. Aurore owns a business selling various styles of clothes. Her husband is a driver. This small family is working hard to save money before they become a big family. Aurore is new entrepreneur with just one year of experience in her business. Her business hours are from 8 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday. 

Aurore is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more bales of clothes. With this expansion, Aurore will be able to satisfy her customers and this satisfaction will allow her to earn some profits to use for her family and her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old and single. Grace has owned a shop since 2009 where she sells different kinds of drinks. Her shop is open from 8 am to 10 pm every day.

Grace needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing additional drinks and different kinds of pastries. If successful, she will hopefully earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for  better financial stability. In addition, she will continue saving for her future.

loans.use: different kinds of juice, water, margarines, etc

loans.name: Nakalasa Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
32-year-old Steven O. is happily married and has one child. He belongs to the Nakalasa Development Group—Lugazi. For the last twelve years Steven has been involved in commercial agriculture. Before this he was a subsistence farmer who only grew crops for his family’s consumption. Steven also gets modest profits from his small shop.

Steven describes his clientele as general in scope, meaning he sells to different classes of people. His business generates 100,000 UGX for him monthly. With this loan he wants to purchase manure for his gardens. This, he says, will help improve his crops, thus allowing him to sell his improved yields at a higher competitive market rate.

loans.use: To purchase manure for his gardens

loans.name: Eustachie

texts.en:
Eustachie is 40 years old. She is married and has 4 children.  Eustachie lives by selling tea and some other pastries in her restaurant.  She has been in this business for about 5 years. Her business hours are from 6 am to 7 pm every day.

Eustachie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Eustachie plans to start selling food in a restaurant. Eustachie hopes to use her Kiva loan to reach her her goals. If successful, with the earned profits, Eustachie will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs for sale in the restaurant.

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.fr:
Aline M. est une femme commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite au Quartier Musaga en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique a Musaga, un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 18 mois. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 9e année de l’école secondaire. Son maria fait ses études jusqu’en 10e année,
C’est un chauffeur. Elle arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3enfants qui sont à l’école primaire.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  changer le type de business en tenant un restaurant mais aussi continuer en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup de facilites a rembourser. Son rêve est de  mener une meilleure vie ensemble avec ma famille au travers du commerce qu’elle a commencé.
 
Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Haguruka».
texts.en:
Aline M. is a woman merchant, aged 32, who lives in the Musaga districts of Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  There in Musaga, she runs a grocery store.  This is a trade that she has been working at for eighteen months.  She has attended the 9th grade.  Her husband has attended the 10th grade.  He is a chauffeur.  

Aline is the mother of three children who are in primary school.  She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to make a change to running a restaurant business but also to continue with her shop by buying large amounts of food products to resell to customers.  Thus, she will be able to increase her savings.  She has preferred to ask Turame for a loan because it would be easy for her repay.   

Through the business she started, she has a dream to lead a better life together with her family.  

She is a member of the community group "Haguruka".

loans.use: changer le type de business en tenant un restaurant mais aussi continuer en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en: Sos B. is a skilled and experienced businessman who has longstanding relationships with his suppliers and customers. He trades in leather clothing and shoes from one of the city markets and also distributes goods to another trader in the same market. Sos started his business in 1992 with $2000 startup capital, working in Armenia’s border region. Sos moved to Yerevan in 1999 to be with his loving wife and 3 children and has applied for this loan to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: To purchase clothing stock

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 51 years old and is married with seven children who are between 5 and 10 years old. She is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of foodstuffs such as different kinds of flour, plus rice, beans, wheat, etc. She has been in this business for about two years and her business hours are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Marthe needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to satisfy the demands of her customers. In addition to that, she will start selling Irish potatoes as they are asked for by a large number of her customers.

If successful, Marthe really hopes that she will earn a lot of money which, in turn, will allow her to keep expanding her business, create some other sources of income, and continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs to sell such as different kinds of flour, rice, beans, wheat, etc., and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk S., his wife and three children live with Hayk’s mother in Arteni village, Armenia. The family's main income comes from land cultivation and cattle breeding. Hayk is very good in taking care of his own and neighbours' fruit orchids. During the harvest, Hayk collects fruits from his and neighbours’ orchids and sells in the nearby cities. To increase the life of fruits and thus extend the business season, Hayk is planning to build a cooler for fruits.

loans.use: Building a cooler for fruit.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 41 years old and is married with seven children. She is well-known in the business of selling foodstuffs such as beans, peas, rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flour, etc. She has been in this business for about two years and her business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Therese needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to increase the quantity of her foodstuffs: mainly beans, peas, rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flour, etc. With this additional quantity, she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to provide the basic needs to her family and start saving for her future. In addition to that, she will buy a cow to raise at home.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs such as beans, peas, rice, cooking oil, different kinds of flour, etc.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik M.’s wife and 3 children live together with Gagik’s mother in Goris, Armenia. While Gagik’s wife takes care of chickens and pigs, Gagik takes the cattle for summer to the mountains. The family has been involved in agriculture for 7 years. To increase the income and take better care of his family and children Gagik is planning to purchase 3 cows.

loans.use: Towards purchasing cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 15 and 18 years old. He is well-known in the business of driving a taxi which he has been doing for about one year. His hours of driving are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Jean de Dieu, after having a serious accident with his taxi to the extent that his taxi was damaged, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he will purchase some spare parts for his taxi so it can be fully repaired. After repairing his taxi via the use of this Kiva loan, he will hopefully increase his daily profits and he really hopes that his goal of buying another taxi will be reached.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena L. is from the town of Panglao. She is 46 years old. Ma. Elena is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 2. To make a living, Ma. Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Ma. Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur D. lives in Yeghnik village of Aragatsotn region, Armenia.  Artur lives with his parents and 3 brothers. The family’s main income comes from agriculture: land cultivation and farming. To make extra money Artur and his brothers are also working at a local quarry. 

Artur has applied for the loan to purchase cattle. The brother’s dream is to have a sustained household economy, so they can marry and have families.

loans.use: purchasing cattle

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne M. aged 58, is the manager of a Community Bank named “Lisungi Plus” which means “Assistance” in English. It is composed of 19 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Anne has been a part of the micro-enterprise world since 1991. She started selling shikwanges (Congolese food)beginning with a capital of $100. She has been with Hope since October 2008. Progressively, her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. 

The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges and sell them with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $50 per week. Anne’s ambition is to open a general store. She is a widow and a mother of nine children between the ages 18 and 34. One of them attends school.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges (Congolese food) and sell them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Germie

texts.en:
Germie G. is from the town of Panglao. She is 48 years old. Germie is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Germie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing taxi services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tour van services. Germie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Germie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Germie and is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to repair an  existing vehicle for better service and to purchase tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle  and purchase tires to provide better service

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: El señor Luis Miguel es una persona muy dedicada al bienestar de su familia, el y su esposa la señora Azucena, trabajan en una maquiladora todo el día, tienen dos hijos pequeños y los dejan al cuidado de la mama de la señora Azucena, no están en todo el día en su casa, la cual tienen poco con ella, ya que la adquirieron de interés social. Ellos necesitan mucho el dinero por que hace pocos días entraron unas personas a robar en su vivienda, y por esto quieren construir una barda en la parte trasera de la vivienda. Ellos temen por su seguridad y la de sus hijos, y agradecen su enorme ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is a person who is dedicated to his family’s wellbeing. He and his wife, Azucena, work in a maquiladora (assembly plant) all day. They have two small children that they leave in Azucena’s mother’s care. They are away from home all day. They have owned their house for just a short period of time. They purchased it through a low-income, government subsidized loan program. They need the funds very much because recently people broke into their home to steal. They want to build a wall on the rear of the property. They fear for their children’s safety and are grateful for this enormous help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Kikoni 2 Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
M. Moses of the Kikoni 2 Twimukye Group is a hardworking, grinding business man. The 41-year-old married father of five children, some of whom are still in school, sweats his guts out selling produce like bananas and beans in a small rural area of Kikoni, Ibanda. He has been doing this business, which he started with the advice and support from his parents, 12 years ago. He gets many customers who buy his produce for food consumption, like restaurant owners in the area.
 
He is able to make an average profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards, as such he requires a loan that will help him buy more farm inputs like mulches and manure for his banana plantation. Then he will be able to meet the customers' demand and also get more revenue as he looks after his family's welfare and the education of his children.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs like mulches and manure

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es: Vivian R. es una mujer soltera que tiene  41 años de edad y confecciona todo tipo de ropas,aprendizaje que adquirió de su tia con la cual vive y trabaja; su experiencia data desde el 2002 cuando al observarla  se interesó en este negocio, pero solo  hasta el 2004 lo inició; su especialidad es  la ropa deportiva y ultimamente consiguio como clientes colegios quienes le hicieron un pedido, por eso necesita  comprar telas, para fabricarle esta línea a sus estudiantes, igualmente  necesita comprar una máquina  terminadora,  con la cual aumentará  la calidad de estos productos y seguramente ganará nuevos clientes.  Este es justamente la razón por la cual solicita  su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización en la que fue  referida por una buena cliente de la Fundación y Vivian con ella de la mano sueña con crecer, porque  su meta es ampliar su taller de confecciones, para continuar aumentando su nivel de vida; actualmente no tiene un capital de trabajo adicional, que la ayude profundizar el mercado de instituciones educativas  y el poco capital con el cual trabaja, no  le permite responder efectivamente a sus clientes reales, que son los colegios a quienes les confecciona sudaderas, ropa deportiva y buzos, para que sus estudiantes practiquen las actividades deportivas, incluidas en su currículo. Otro de sus mercados son los vecinos a quienes les fabrica vestidos, porque la conocen y le gusta como trabaja Vivian  las confecciones y ella espera hacerle su ropa de fin de año para que luzcan elegantes y continuen como sus clientes rentables.
texts.en:
Vivian R., 41, is single. She makes all kinds of clothes. She learned these skills from her aunt with whom she lives and works. Her experience dates back to 2002 when she became interested in this kind of work watching her aunt but only since 2004 that she actually went into it. Her specialty is athletic wear and recently she acquired as customers local schools that placed an order. She, therefore, needs to buy fabric to manufacture this line of student athletic clothes. She also needs to buy a finishing sewing machine that will allow her to improve the quality of her products and surely gain new customers. This is precisely why she is asking for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she was referred to by a good client of the Fundación. Vivian plans to grow hand in hand with it because her goal is to enlarge her workshop to continue improving her quality of life. She currently lacks additional working capital that would help her deepen her involvement with educational institutions and the little capital she works with does not allow her to respond effectively to the real customers she has which are the schools for which she makes sportswear so that the students can participate in athletic activities that are part of the curriculum. Another one of her markets is neighbors for whom she makes dresses because they know her and like the way Vivian makes clothes. She hopes to make their clothes for the end of year festivities so that they will look elegant and continue to be profit generating customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make athletic clothes for students.

loans.name: Duteraninkuga No 6 Group

texts.fr:
Marcianne U., naquit à Ruhuha  l’Est du Rwanda, elle a 45 ans, elle est marié et elle a 7 enfants, son ainé a 22 ans et son cadet a 6 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. 5 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Elle appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé DUTERANINKUNGA NO 6,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Marcianne et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals  pour leurs enfantset ravitailler leurs maisons. Le groupe a contracté un deuxième prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les felitilisants de leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue pour le compte du groupe et une autre est utilisée pour la survie des familles.
texts.en:
Marcianne U., born in Ruhuha in the East Province of Rwanda, is 45 years old, and married with seven children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and her youngest is six. She finished secondary school. She lives with her family in Ruhuha Bugesera. Five of her children attend school.

She belongs to a solidarity group Duteraninkunga No 6; the group members are rice farmers who guarantee each other’s loans. Geredi and his group work in order to support their families and offer them better life conditions as well as to pay school fees for their children. The group has taken out a second loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to purchase fertilizers for their field. After harvesting, one part of the produce is sold and the other used by the families.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Pole Pole Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Sixty-eight-year-old Yasin K. belongs to the Pole Pole Group-Jinja. He is father to eight kids and runs a six-year-old retail shop. Customers to his shop vary, but it’s mostly fishermen who patronize his shop. His business got its foothold with savings from a farming business. From the onset, he has exhibited hard work and it has brought him rewards. In a week, he is able to make 100,000 shillings and with this loan, he wants to buy tomato seeds that he will plant. After harvesting, he says he will sell the produce.

loans.use: The purchase of tomato seeds that he will plant

loans.name: Seihry Isabel

texts.es: La señora Seihry es Madre soltera de dos niños, es una mujer muy admirable ya que ah sacado a sus hijos adelante. Ella trabaja mucho para darles a sus pequeños hijos lo mejor. Hace poco tiempo adquirió una casa de interés social  pero no se ah ido a vivir ahí por que teme por la seguridad de ella y de sus hijos, por eso esta solicitando este crédito, para construir una barda al frente de su vivienda y así poder vivir ahí con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Seihry is a single mother of two children. She is an admirable woman in that she has managed to move her children ahead. She works hard to provide her young children with the best. She recently acquired a house through a government subsidized, low income housing program but hasn’t moved in yet because she fears for her own and her children’s safety. This is why she’s asking for a loan to build a wall in the front of the property so that she can live there with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Diamantina

texts.es: La señora Diamantina es es una persona muy trabajadora, quedo viuda desde hace varios años, ella tiene tres hijos mayores los cuales ya están casados por eso vive sola, la señora Diamantina necesita de este crédito para la compostura del techo de su casa, ya que esta muy dañado por  las lluvias.
texts.en:
Diamantina is a very hard working person. She was widowed several years ago and has three adult children who are married. She lives alone. Diamantina needs this loan to repair the roof on her house because the rains have damaged it a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Luzolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzuzi D., aged 42, is the manager of a Community Bank named “Luzolo Plus”. It is composed of 15 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Nzuzi single, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1988. He sells beverages. His business is located to the south-west of Kinshasa. Nzuzi has already received six times the MFI HOPE DRC loans and repaid them correctly. The loan he will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell retail with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of $73 per week. Nzuzi’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area. He has a son and takes care of two other children who attend school.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his business by buying crates of beverages to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia C., photographed with one of her children, is from the town of Panglao. She is 59 years old. Gelasia is married and has 12 children. To make a living, Gelasia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Gelasia says she and her husband work hard to be able to provide for their family.

Gelasia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelasia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gelasia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repairan  existing vehicle to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To repair an  existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Edwin Fernando

texts.es: En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrio al sur de Barranquilla, vive un joven de 27 años como mucha madurez y capacidad de trabajo emprendedor,  que aprendió desde antes de terminar el bachillerato, cuando debía realizar sus estudios, a sus  12 años  mientras trabajaba en una tienda como empleado;  esta experiencia fue significativa en su vida y le dio la firmeza,  para iniciar su propia iniciativa de negocio que hoy lleva por nombre  llamada “Tienda MAFE” con la cual se independizó a los 20 años y que  ha logrado estabilizar, desde antes de cumplir sus actuales 27 años de edad. En su negocio ha tenido múltiples desafíos, como cuando muchos de sus clientes no le pagaron una vez llevaron a crédito sus mercancías, sin embargo esto no lo desanimó y siguió adelante, pero teniendo el cuidado de escoger bien a su clientela para los asuntos de créditos, ahora sus ventas a créditos son muy poca, vende casi la totalidad de su mercancía de contado.  Así mismo en algún momento fue víctima de atracos pero con la ayuda de sus padres siguió su meta de sostener su negocio, eso sí contando también con su hermana que es como su mano derecha. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  mercancía como víveres, ranchos, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar para reemplazar los créditos de sus proveedores y ganarse los descuentos por compras de contado. Su ideal es tener una casa propia pues actualmente vive  en arriendo, su mayor desafío es no tener historia crediticia y las organizaciones financieras no le aprueban los créditos, por eso ha acudido a la Fundación para hacer su primera experiencia financiera y crecer a su lado.
texts.en:
A 27-year-old, mature, enterprising, young man lives in Ciudadela 20 de Julio, a neighborhood in south Barranquilla. When he was just 12 years old, not even finishing high school yet, he started working as an employee in a store. This experience was significant in his life in that it made him determined to start his own business which today is called “Tienda MAFE” with which he became independent at the age of 20 and which he has managed to stabilize before his present age of 27. He has faced several challenges in his store like when many customers who had taken items on credit didn’t pay him. However, this did not discourage him and he continued forward just being more careful about choosing customers when credit was the issue. Now his sales on credit are very few; he sells almost his entire stock of merchandise for cash. At one time or another he was also a victim of holdups but with help from his parents he continued toward his goal of stabilizing the business always counting on help from his sister who is his right hand. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy merchandise like: foodstuffs, snacks, beverages and the usual items that go into a family’s daily needs. He will also use it to pay debts he has with his suppliers and gain the discounts offered for cash purchases. His ideal is to own his house because he currently rents. His greatest challenge is a lack of credit history that makes him ineligible for loans from financial institutions. This is why he’s called upon the Fundación to undergo his first experience with financing; he hopes to grow alongside it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa María quedo viuda muy joven, tiene siete hijos ya que se caso muy joven, pero es una persona admirable ella sola logro sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, ella inicio un negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, solicita este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio, quiere comprar mas estufas para cocer las tortillas y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa María was widowed very young. She has seven children because she married very young. She is admirable because she managed to raise all her children by herself. She stared a flour tortilla making business. She is asking for the loan so that her business can grow. She wants to buy more stoves to cook the tortillas thus increasing profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stove.

loans.name: Andrea Adelina

texts.es: La sra. Andrea Adelina M. tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 29, 27, 25 y 23 años, reside en el Barrio Bella Vista en la ciudad de Catacamas, Olancho. Andrea tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de productos alimenticios como lo son las tortillas de maíz, nacatamales y golosinas, entre otros productos. Inició vendiendo tortillas de maíz para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos. En la actualidad ella, dos de sus hijas y una nuera se levantan todos los días a las 3:00 am, ya que tienen un contrato y deben entregar las tortillas a las 8:00 am. También vende nacatamales de carne y pollo, tamalitos de frijoles, y los domingos hace tacos de carne.  Su ventaja es que trabaja en su propia casa y una dificultad que enfrenta es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para elaborar una mayor cantidad de productos. Andrea solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materia prima como maíz, frijoles, leña, hoja de mata de mínimo verde para envolver los nacatamales, carne, aceite y condimentos.  Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá elaborar sus productos y obtener ganancias, y mejorar su condición su vida y la de su familia. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y con el apoyo de los préstamos ha podido ir creciendo en su negocio y en la diversificación de los productos que elabora.
texts.en: Andrea Adelina M., 49, is a single mother of 4 children aged 29, 27, 25, and 23 years.  She lives in the Bella Vista neighborhood of the city of Catacamos, Olancho.  Andrea has been making food such as corn tortillas, nacatamales (a type of large tamale typical of Central America), sweets, and other dishes for 15 years.  She started out selling corn tortillas to support her 4 children.  Now, Andrea and 2 of her children and a daughter-in-law get up early every day at 3am, since they have a deal where they must deliver tortillas at 8am.  In addition, she sells nacatamales made of chicken and meat, small bean tamales, and on Sundays she makes beef tacos.  Her advantage is that she can work out of her own house.  One difficulty she faces is that she doesn't have enough money to make a greater quantity of products.  Andrea requests a loan so that she can buy supplies such as corn, beans, firewood, green plantain leaves (to wrap the nacatamales in), meat, cooking oil and condiments.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to make her products and have better earnings so that she can improve the living conditions of herself and her family.  This is her 3rd loan cycle with FAMA, and with the support of these loans she has been able to grow her business and diversify the products that she makes.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, firewood, meat, cooking oil, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Esmeralda quedo viuda muy joven, después de eso inicio un pequeño negocio en su casa y con los ingresos de ese negocio saco a sus hijos adelante, es por eso que ella requiere de este crédito, para comprar mas mercancía para la tienda de abarrotes, para elevar sus ingresos y si seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Esmeralda was widowed very young. After this she opened a small store in her home and with income from it is raising her children. She needs funds to buy more stock merchandise for her grocery store to increase income and continue to support her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly D. L. C. es una joven D. 25 años y es la propietaria del estadero llamado “Estadero DonD.  Nataly” vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores D. 3 y 6 años D. edad, en el barrio Pastrana del Municipio Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar.
Su negocio inició hace un año, cuando Nataly alquiló un local y puso a funcionar un estadero D. ambiente familiar, allí venD. toda clase D. refrescos y bebidas frías,eso si,  amenizada por la buena música del Caribe.  Nataly Inició su actividad emprendedora para apoyar los ingresos familiares, pues su esposo ofrece el servicio D. moto taxi en este municipio donD. es usual este tipo D. transporte. Este negocio ha tenido muy buena acogida y su clientela va en aumento, especialmente los fines D. semana,  días en los que salen las familias a divertirse y disfrutar D. la cercanía con el mar, además D. un ambiente agradable como el que se vive en el “Estadero DonD. Nataly”. Este es el primer crédito D. Nataly con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar al por mayor bebidas y refrescos para evitar comprarle a los intermediarios, que le venden con sobrecostos; con su compra directa, se estaría ahorrando $105.000 COP mensuales por encima D. lo que paga cuando compra a los intermediarios, pues semanalmente adquiere 30 cajas D. bebidas y cada caja se encarece en $3.500 COP.y por esta razon no ve sus utilidades, pues no son representativas.
Su sueño más adelante es mejorar sus instalaciones locativas y brindar así un mejor servicio; su mayor desafío es la competencia, porque cuenta con locales mucho más cómodos,  pero Nataly. responD. a su debilidad con una excelente y personalizada atención, por eso tiene clientes fijos que la reconocen y que   prefieren pasarla muy feliz con su familia en su sencillo estadero
texts.en:
Nataly D. L. C. is just 25 years old and already owns a snack bar called “Estadero DonD. Nataly.” She lives with her spouse and two children, who are 3 and 6 years old, in the Pastrana neighborhood of Puerto Colombia, very near the ocean. She started the business a year ago when she acquired the locale and started a family-oriented snack bar. She sells all kinds of refreshments and cold beverages maD. more appetizing by good Caribbean music. Nataly started her entrepreneurial activity in order to contribute to family income because her husband works as a mototaxi driver in this municipality where this type of transportation is the norm. The business has been very well received and her customer base is growing, especially on weekends which is when families go out to have fun and enjoy being near the ocean. Besides, they enjoy a pleasant atmosphere at “Estadero DonD. Nataly.” This is Nataly’s first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use it to buy beverages and refreshments avoiding buying them from middlemen who sell them at higher prices. By buying direct, she will save $105,000 COP a month compared to what she spends when she buys from middlemen. She buys 30 cases of beverages per week and each case she buys from them has a $3,500 COP surcharge so she earns little or no profits from them that way. Her dream for the future is to improve the locale’s conditions thereby providing better service. Her greatest challenge is competition because there are similar locations that are more comfortable. However, Nataly’s answer to her shortcoming is to proviD. excellent, personalized customer service. This is why she has regular customers that recognize this quality of hers and prefer to spend a pleasant time with their families in her less flashy establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages at wholesale in order to avoid purchasing from middlemen who sell at higher prices.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta S. is from the town of Panglao. She is 54 years old. Norberta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norberta owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Norberta works hard to sustain her children's education. She dreams to see them graduate from college and have bright futures.

Norberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norberta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Norberta is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Prosper K. is a member of the Rwemengo Tumanyane loan group (pictured here) and a 53-year-old married father with seven boisterous children. To meet his large family's expenses, he has operated a grocery store in the Rwemengo Trading Centre for the last ten years. Mostly, he sells bananas and coffee. His business has done well but has also faced many challenges, including the absence of a regular revenue source. However, his business has remained successful because of Prosper's hard work and attention to customer relations. He makes 120,000 Ugandan shillings a month, and has applied for a loan to restock and expand his store so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to restock and expand his grocery store

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is 53 years old and is married with seven children. He is well-known in the business of selling cosmetics. He has been in this business for about eight years and his business hours are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Yusufu, after realizing how much the number of his customers has increased and how small his business place is, is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase the size of his business as well as the size of his business place.

If successful, Yusufu hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.
