loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics such as body lotion, soap, etc.

loans.name: Olga Elidia

texts.es: La señora Olga Elidía , es madre soltera de dos hijos, los saco adelante vendiendo ropa usada para pagar sus estudios, ah venido haciendo crecer su negocio y ahorita ya tiene un su propia casa y abrió otro negocio de compra y venta de chatarra, gracias a su gran esfuerzo a logrado salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Es una persona admirable como madre y mujer trabajadora. La señora Olga necesita este crédito para surtir ropa nueva para su venta y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga Elidía is a single mother of two children, who is getting ahead by selling used clothes, in order to pay for her children's studies. Her business has been growing, and now she has her business in her own house. She opened another business buying and selling scrap metal. Thanks to her great effort, she has been able to get ahead and improve her quality of life. She is an admirable person, as both a mother and a working woman. Olga needs this loan in order to supply new clothes to sell, and therefore earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Alegria De Amaranto Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Alegría de amaranto, está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes.
María Delfina Domínguez H. es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta el 6 año de primaria,  es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de servilletas bordadas que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para compara mas material para poder hacer mas servilletas e invertir en tela, listón e hilos. Sus clientes son personas de la misma localidad, al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta, y con mucho entusiasmo. También espera poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa pues aun les falta mucho para su casa.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
* LIVIA G. P. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
* AGUSTINA G. G. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
* IMELDA G. V. VENTA DE ROPA
* LUCIA M. P. VENTA DE DULCES
* GRISELDA P. G. VENTA DE MOLCAJETES
* CAROLINA R. M. VENTA DE SABANAS
* PATRICIA S. M. MISELANIA
* AGUSTINA T. R. VENTA DE TORTILLAS
texts.en:
This group is called "Alegría de amaranto" (Amaranth joy), and is located in Mexico.  The group is made up of nine members.  María Delfina Domínguez H. is the president of the group.  She is 25 years old, and studied until the 6th year of primary school.  She is a shopkeeper and has two young boys.  She sells embroidered napkins, which she began two years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more material in order to be able to make more napkins and invest in fabric, ribbon, and thread.  Her customers are from the same town.  At the moment of requesting the loan, she feels happy, and has a lot of enthusiasm.  Also, she hopes to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, because they are still lacking a lot for their home.

The other members of the group are:
* LIVIA G. P. Sells tortillas
* AGUSTINA G. G. Sells tortillas
* IMELDA G. V. Sells clothes
* LUCIA M. P. Sells sweets
* GRISELDA P. G. Sells mortars (stone bowls used to make salsas)
* CAROLINA R. M. Sells sheets
* PATRICIA S. M. Small general store
* AGUSTINA T. R. Sells tortillas

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: El señor Leopoldo es un hombre solo, ya que no esta casado, es un hombre de admirar, ya que cuando era joven tubo una hija y el la ha tenido desde que estaba muy chica, el señor Leopoldo empezó un negocio de venta de abarrotes para así poder estar al pendiente de su hija y de su casa, para poder darse tiempo para llevar y traer a su hija de la escuela y estar en los eventos importantes de la pequeña, ahora ella ya esta grande y le ayuda a el en la tienda de abarrotes que tiene, el solicita este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía y así elevar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Leopoldo is a single man, since he isn't married.  He is a man to admire, since when he was young, he had a daughter, and he has had her [in his care] since she was a young girl.  Leopoldo began a business selling groceries, so that his daughter could depend on him and their home, and to be able to spend time with her, and take her to school, and be at her important events.  Now she is older, and she helps him in the grocery store that he has.  He is requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise and increase his income.

loans.use: Investment in his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vodacom Group

texts.en:
Zuwena M. is in her early thirties and is married with four children. She has been running her own food stall since 2009. The stall is open daily between 12 and 9 pm and earns Zuwena a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuwena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Zuwena hopes to to increase her stock to meet rising demand for her goods. Her dream is to one day expand her stall into a proper food shop.

Zuwena will share this loan with her loan group Vodacom, which totals 15 members. The group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Zuwena can be seen in the front, in the center, wearing a bright blue dress with a black scarf.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods.

loans.name: Irembo Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée M. est une femme commerçante âgée de 58 ans qui habite au Quartier Kamenge en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des habits pour toutes catégories depuis 25 ans. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est une veuve. Elle arrive au 8e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2enfants qui sont adultes et qu’elle ne prend plus en charge.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital afin d’importer les habits de l’Ouganda et ainsi augmenter la quantité des habits  à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle espère en plus, qu’avec des économies générées de ce business, elle parviendra à parachever la construction de  sa propre maison  qu’elle a commencer a bâtir.
 
 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Irembo»
texts.en:
Dorothée M. is a 58-year-old retailer who lives in the Kamenge district of Bujumbura. She is a widow and the mother of two independent, adult children. 

Dorothée did not attend school. She has been selling all kinds of clothes for 25 years. She is currently in the 8th cycle of community credit with the Turame MFI.
  
Dorothée is seeking credit through Kiva to bolster her capital in order to import clothes from Uganda, thereby increasing her stocks, and hopefully, boosting her profits. She hopes to have more capital in the future, which would enable her to run a large business. She also hopes that the savings from her business will help to finish construction on her house.

Dorothée is a member of the Irembo community group.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to import clothes from Uganda, increase her stocks, and make substantial profits

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unidos y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen sus compañerismo.
Asi ademas de los trabajos que relizan en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos, cada una tiene una activdad indepediente.
La mayoria de las integrantes se dedica a la cria de animales y hortalizas en la huertas que tienen en sus  casas.
Una de las ellas es la señora Veronica quien se dedica la cria de animales y rubros agrícolas.
Entre los animales que cria se encuentran, gallinas, patos, cerdos, y vacas.
Ella recurre a la venta de los animales en varias ocasiones durante el mes, cuando necesita dinero para su familia ya que el marido es agricultor y los dos ni cuentan con ingresos fijos periodicos.
Comenta que esta actividad es lo que en muchas ocasiones pudo salvar a la familia y que por ello es muy importante manten esta actividad.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de tejidos de alambres para la construccion de un corral para sus animales ya que facilitara el manejo de los mismos.
texts.en:
The members form a very unified group, and are capable of working together in activities that strengthen their camaraderie. In addition to their jobs, they work together to collect funds. Each one has her own independent business activity. The majority of the members raise animals and grow vegetables in the gardens that they have in their houses. One of the women is Veronica, who raises animals and agricultural items. Amongst the animals that she raises, you can find chickens, ducks, pigs, and cows.

She sells the animals on various occasions during the month, when she needs money for her family, since her husband is a farmer, and neither one counts on fixed periodical income. She says that this activity on many occasions was able to save the family and for that reason, it is very importan to maintain the activity. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of wire fencing in order to build a corral for her animals, since it will make it easier to handle them.

loans.use: To buy wire fencing

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Aminata K.. She is married and has three children, aged 18, 16 and 10 years. In the year 2000, Aminata established her lace and cotton material business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband in providing a livelihood for their family. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. Aminata requires the loan in order to buy more cotton and lace materials for her stall. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business to the level of becoming a wholesaler in clothing, to build a house for her family and to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of lace and cotton materials

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 27 years old and is married with two children: the first one is 9 and the last is 1 year old. She also takes care of two relatives.

Hamida is businesswoman and her husband is a driver. Both work seriously in order to provide all the basic needs for their family. Hamida owns a small business selling various styles of women’s clothes and has been in the business since 2007. She employs one person from her community as a helper.

Hamida is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing more women’s clothes. With this expansion, she will be able to satisfy her customers which, in turn, will help her to earn more profits to use in her business and for her family as well.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Lugano Group

texts.en:
Ashery S. is in his early 40s and is married with four children. He has been running a cobbler business for five years. The shop is open between 6:30 a.m. and 7 p.m. and earns Ashery a good monthly profit.

This will be Ashery's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Ashery aims to buy a sewing machine so that he can expand his cobbler business in order to repair shoes as well. 

Ashery will share this loan with his loan group Lugano, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Ashery can be seen to the far right, wearing dark glasses.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Tuzmurane Group

texts.fr:
Geredi M., naquit à Ruhuha  l’Est du Rwanda, il a 65 ans, il est marié et il a 4 enfants, son ainé a 43 ans et son cadet a 28 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé TUZAMURANE,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Geredi et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les felitilisants de leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Geredi M. was born in Ruhuha, in eastern Rwanda. He is 65 years old, married and has 4 children. His eldest is 43 years old and his youngest is 28. He attended primary school. He lives with his family in Ruhuha Bugesera. All of his children have gone to school.
He belongs to Tuzamurane, a solidarity group of rice growers who guarantee each other’s loans. Geredi and his group work to support their families by improving their quality of life and paying their children’s school fees.
The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy fertilisers for their fields. At harvest time, part of the crop is sold and the rest is saved for their families.

loans.use: Purchase of fertiliser

loans.name: Haleluya Group

texts.en:
Genrose N. is in her late 40s and is widowed with three children. She has been running a charcoal business for the past five years. Her business is open between 6 a.m. and 7 p.m. daily and earns Genrose a good monthly profit.

This will be Genrose's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet the demand of her clients. Genrose aims to use her third loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal. 

Genrose will share this loan with her loan group Haleluya, which totals 21 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Genrose can be seen in the back row, on the far right.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Edna María

texts.es:
Egna María L. V. inicio con la venta de ropa de niños como vio que era rentable decidió ofrecer otros productos como ropa para adultos, prendas y perfumes. En la actualidad comercializa más las prendas y perfumes  en lo cual invertirá el préstamo.

Ella hace un año aproximadamente que empezó a trabajar con Adim como miembro de un grupo solidario y ahora se graduó a individual.
texts.en: Egna María L. V. started by selling children's clothes, and as she saw that it was profitable, she decided to offer other products such as clothing for adults, garments, and perfumes.  Currently, she markets the garments and perfumes more, and it is in these that she will invest the loan.  About one year ago, she began working with ADIM as a member of the community bank, and how she has graduated to individual loans.

loans.use: Garments and perfumes

loans.name: Yadira Cecilia

texts.es: Yadira 	T. es una mujer de 69 años,  de estado civil  casada y con  5 hijos en las edades de 31 a 43 años. Ella ciudad de Cartagena ella tiene un negocio de vender mercancías variadas desde su vivienda, el cual inició comprando artículos plásticos económicos para amas de casa,  que  repartía entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos,  y que le dieron su primera utilidad. En la medida en que fue creciendo su negocio  fue añadiéndole cosméticos y medicinas y compró su primera vitrina. En la actualidad  su negocio permanece surtido y exhibe mucho de sus productos. Este es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, durante 4 años de estar vinculada a esta organización;  con los anteriores ha logrado fortalecer su negocio e incursionar en otras líneas de productos  y mejorar su infraestructura, pues desde que compró vitrinas mantiene mayor control y mucho orden en sus  mercancías. Con su credikiva comprará cosméticos, sombrillas, colonias y medicinas que no requieren prescripción médica, con esta inversión logrará nuevas utilidades y  la oportunidad de seguir creciendo, porque  su sueño es tener un almacén en donde toda la familia tenga la opción de emplearse y de ser muy productivos.
texts.en:
Yadira T. is a 69 year old woman.  She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 31 and 43 years old.  She lives in Cartagena and sells different kinds of merchandise out of her home.  She stared by buying inexpensive plastic items for housewives that she would sell to her friends, family and neighbors and this is how she made her first profit.  Her business grew to such an extent that she added cosmetics and medicines and bought her first showcase.  Currently, her business is stocked and displays many of her products.  

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo during her 4 years of association with this organization.  The previous loans have enable her to strengthen her business, venture into other lines of products and to improve its infrastructure.  Also, since she bought her showcase she has been able to maintain more control and organization of her merchandise.  

With her Kiva  loan she will buy cosmetics, umbrellas, cologne and over-the-counter medicines.  This will help to increase her profits and give her business the opportunity to continue growing because her dream is to have a store where everyone in the family has the option of working and of being very productive.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, umbrellas, colognes and over-the-counter medicines

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 25 years old and is married with two children. He is a businessman and his wife is in business as well. This family is serious in their daily activities because they are visionary.

Jean Claude owns a business selling bedsheets. He has an experience of ten years in this field and the hours of his business are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day.

Now, Jean Claude is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more bedsheets for sale. With this expansion, he will be able to attract more customers and earn more profits which he will use for his family and in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en:
Amiel is 43 years old and is married with six children. He is well-known in the business of selling a variety of foodstuffs such as beans, maize, etc. He has been in this business for a long time and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Amiel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to hopefully expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs so as to satisfy the demand of his customers. If successful, he will earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better expansion of his business and enable him to continue providing the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as beans, wheat, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 52 years old and is married with four children who are 14, 16, 17 and 18 years old.

Theogene has owned a shop selling a variety of electronic and electrical items since 2007 and his business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Theogene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to increase the size of his business by adding more electrical and electronic items such as electric cables, loudspeakers, etc. With these additional items for sale, Theogene will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and enable him to continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of electrical and electronic items such as loudspeakers, torches, cables, etc.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Daines E. is in her mid-twenties and is married. Since 2009, she has been running her own beauty salon. The salon is open between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m. and earns Daines a good monthly profit. 

This will be Daines' second Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Daines used her previous loan, which she has successfully repaid, to buy a hair dryer. With this new loan, Daines aims to buy new salon equipment for her business. Her dream is to one day own the most popular salon in the area.

Daines will share this loan with her loan group Saranga, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Daines is standing in the back row, third from the left in the red and orange dress.

loans.use: Buy new salon equipment

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma tiene una tienda de abarrotes que ha hecho crecer con muchos esfuerzos, le ah dedicado mucho tiempo y ahora es una tienda mas grande y con mas variedad de abarrotes, ella y su esposo se han encargado de levantar el negocio, requieren de este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para surtir la tienda de  abarrotes.
texts.en: Norma has a grocery store that she has helped to grow with a lot of effort.  She has dedicated a lot of time to it and it is now a bigger store with a greater variety of groceries.  She and her husband have been in charge of boosting the business.  They need this loan for the purchase of more merchandise to stock the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 22 years old and is still single. He is well-known in the business of selling dishes and some other domestic items. He has been in this business for about six years and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Fabien needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business through purchasing different kinds of dishes and some additional domestic items. If successful, he will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition, he will create some other sources of income, providing jobs for people in his community.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as dishes and some additional domestic items

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Estanislao del Asentamiento Santa Rosa .  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales etc. 
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Este comité ya están en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras. 
La señora Maria es una de las integrantes, una señora muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta  de varios productos. 
Ella tiene un negocio un negocio en su casa el cual le ayuda mucho con los gasto de su familia y al mismo tiempo para el progreso de la misma.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para el negocio como yerba mate, harina, productos de limpieza, y otros.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (Hope) Group was started by several neighbor ladies in the city of San Estanislao del Asentamiento Santa Rosa. All of the members work independently in sales, preparing fast food, raising animals, etc. They formed a very united group capable of working to strengthen their unity. This group is in its third loan cycle, and they have shown punctuality, solidarity and unity among themselves.

Mrs. Maria is one of the members. She is a very hard-working woman who sells different products. She has a business in her home that does a lot to help with the family's expenses and with their progress. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business like tea, flour, cleaning products, and others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (groceries, beverages, cleaning products)

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en:
Edouard is 52 years old and is married with nine children. He is well-known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and has been in this business for about ten years. His business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Although Edouard has been in the business for a long time, his capital is still too low to expand his business meaningfully. To solve this problem, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he hopes that he will satisfy the demand of his customers by purchasing a large quantity of Irish potatoes.

Through the use of his profits, Edouard will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a thirty-two-year-old man who is married with three children and lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

As a civil servant working with local government for five years now, James has been able to upgrade his qualifications. However, as a salary earner, he needs some income-generating activities to boost his income to meet the needs of his family.

James wants to construct a house for his domestic and commercial needs so that he saves rent while, at the same time, he earns it from the tenants he will have.

James intends to use the loan to purchase a plot on which to construct a house for domestic and commercial purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a plot on which to construct a house for domestic and commercial purposes

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es: José Alonso es un jovencito muy trabajador, el mantiene a su hermana de 16 años, por que su mama falleció y ellos se quedaron solos, el se tubo que salir de la escuela para trabajar y mantener a su hermana,  el trabaja prácticamente todo el día, y en su casa empezó un pequeño negocio de tienda de abarrotes para que su hermana después de salir de la escuela atendiera el negocio, ellos solicitan este crédito para comprar mas mercancía y surtir mas la tienda y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: José Alonso is a hardworking youth who supports his 16 year-old sister because his mother died and they were left alone.  He had to leave school to work to support his sister.  He works almost all day long, and in his house he started a small grocery store so that after his sister returns from school she can attend to the business.  They are requesting this loan to buy more merchandise and restock their store so that in this way they can increase their incomes.

loans.use: to invest in his grocery store

loans.name: Masaka Group

texts.en:
Salama R. is in her late forties and is married with two children. Salama has been running a charcoal business since 2007 and her business is open daily between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. Salama's charcoal business earns her a good monthly profit. 

This will be Salama's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Her two previous loans were used to increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet delivery orders. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Salama aims to use her third loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet demand. 

Salama will share this loan with her loan group Masaka, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Salama is seen in the front row, second from left, wearing a dress with blue and green on it.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Domina is 33 years old and is married. She is a self-employed businesswoman selling Irish potatoes. She has been in this business for about ten years and her business hours are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Domina needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business seling Irish potatoes. By using this loan, she hopes that she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

If successful, Domina has a goal of expanding her market through creating more sources of income, thus creating jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 34 years old and is married with six children. He is well-known in the business of selling firewood and has been in this business for about a year. His business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Thomas, after realizing how his capital is still too low to earn enough profits to take care of his family, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he will increase his business of selling firewood in order to satisfy the demands of his customers.

If successful, Thomas will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future and the creation of some other sources of income.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride is 41 years old and is married with six children who are between 6 and 20 years old. She has been a self-employed businesswoman selling foodstuffs since 2000 and her business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Although Bonifride has been in her business for about ten years, her capital is still too low to earn meaningfully. To solve this problem, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as peas, beans, wheat, etc.

With these additional foodstuffs, Bonifride will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as peas, beans, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Vyizigiro Group

texts.fr:
Odette N. est une commercante agee de 38 ans qui habite la commune urbaine de Kamenge en Mairie de Bujumbura.Elle fait le commerce de charbon de bois depuis 4 ans alors qu'elle faisait le commerce de vires avant.Elle est veuve.Elle arrive au 13  cycle dans le credit communautaire avec Turame.

Elle a un enfant unique age de 19 ans qui etudie en 9e annee des etudes secondaires.
Elle demande le credit Turame-Kiva pour augmenter la quantite de charbon de bois a commercialiser dans l'espoir de faire des epargnes.
Elle a toujours prefere le credit Turame par ses facilites d'obtention et de souplesse dans le remboursement contrairement aux autres institutions financieres de la place.

Elle fait partie du groupe communautaire "VYIZIGIRO"
texts.en:
Odette N. is a merchant, aged 38, who lives in the urban community of Kamenge in Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  She has been doing commerce in charcoal for four years, whereas she used to sell staple foods before.  Odette is a widow.  She has an only child, aged 19, who is in his ninth year of secondary studies.  

Odette has achieved her thirteenth community loan cycle with Turame.  She is asking for a Turname-Kiva loan in order to increase the amount of charcoal to sell in the hopes of saving some money.  She has always preferred Turname loans because they are easy to obtain and flexible in their repayment.  This is contrary to the other financial institutions in the area.  

Odette is part of the community group Vyizigiro.

loans.use: Increasing the amount of charcoal to market in the hopes of saving some money

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 40 years old and is married with three children. He owns a shop where he sells a large quantity of foodstuffs such as sorghum, maize, peas, etc. He has been in this business for about seven years and his business hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jean de Dieu needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand the size of his business place and, in addition to that, to purchase an additional quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, wheat, peas, etc.

If he is successful, Jean de Dieu will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to create many sources of income and create more jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: To expand the size of his business place and buy a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, wheat, peas, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ndwanirira

texts.en: J. is a fifty-year-old woman, married with six children; two of the children are below eighteen years of age with two other dependents. Her husband is a retired civil servant, meaning she is in charge of the family's welfare. She is a banker and  is a very hardworking woman, focused and very forward-thinking. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and her dream is to see her children with better qualifications and working in reputable organizations. J. intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 44 years old and she is married with eight children.  Jeanne has owned a knitting machine and it is by using this machine that she earns the basic income for her family.  Jeanne has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from 8 am until late in the evening.

Jeanne needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she expects to buy two additional knitting machines and some other clothing items.  If she gets these two additional knitting machines, she really hopes that her customers will increase as well as her profits.  By getting enough profits, she will continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business for a better future.

loans.use: two additional knitting machines and some other clothing items

loans.name: Massiel Narobia

texts.es: Massiel Narobia tiene 25 años es una joven muy emprendedora. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, ella inicio con esfuerzos propios pues su esposo también le ayuda a transportar los diferentes productos que ofrece ella es una persona muy tranquila y que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Ella sale todos los días a trabajar a ofrecer pantalones, camisas, ropa interior faldas y trajes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Sueña con surtir su negocio y ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer una diversidad de ropa.
texts.en: Massiel Narobia is an enterprising young person who is 25 years old.  She sells clothing.  She started this business with her own efforts and also with the help of her husband, who assists her with transporting the various products that she offers.  She is a very calm person who enjoys interacting with her customers.  She goes out each day to work selling pants, shirts, underwear, skirts and suits from 8 in the morning until 9 at night.  She dreams of stocking her business with more inventory so that she can offer a greater variety of products.  This loan will be used to buy merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety of clothing.

loans.use: working capital to buy clothing

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a man with one son. He is married to one wife, who is also in business. He has been keeping poultry and selling vegetables for five years. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan, George would like to buy a water pump and water pipes for his farm. The rain has been his source of irrigation water in the past and due to seasonality, he decided to seek a loan to supply water to his farm. He also faces the challenge of transportation as he incurs heavy costs taking his farm produce to the market.

He sells poultry and his farm products from his home, door-to-door and at the market. He hopes to construct a bigger poultry house in the future. George joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business capital. 

He owns a home that has electricity but no water. His greatest expenses are transport costs and food.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio es una joven muy emprendedor tiene 27 años. El se dedica a la venta de accesorios de celulares, recargas y reparación de celulares. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, el tiene varios clientes que circulan por su negocio el ofrece muy buenos servicios y también le proporciona a sus clientes el mejor precio, por lo que es joven lleno de vida y con muchas esperanzas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito y lo solicita para la compra de accesorios, carcasas, recargas y teléfonos nuevos para ofrecer a la variedad de clientes que posee.
texts.en: Marco Antonio is a very enterprising young man.  He is 27 years old, and makes a living selling cell phone accessories and refill cards and repairing cell phones.  His business is located outside the market.  Marco Antonio’s customers come to him because his business offers them a very good service and a better price, and so he makes a living this way and has high hopes of improving his quality of life.  This is Marco Antonio's first loan, and he is requesting it in order to purchase cell phone accessories, cases, refill cards, and new telephones so that he can offer these to his customers.

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing cell phone accessories, cases, refill cards, and new phones

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two boys, both of whom attend school. Her husband is employed at the Kenya Ports Authority and he provides for the family's needs. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

For the last four years, Mishi has operated a food-vending business where schoolchildren and neighbors are her major customers. Mishi faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the months of April and August holidays, schools close, hence, the low turnout of customers. She hopes to open a nice restaurant in the future. 

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to improve her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to repair her food stall and purchase iron sheets, timber and plywood.

loans.use: To repair her food stall and purchase iron sheets, timber and plywood

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Ángela Maritza vive en una zona muy poblada, no está casada pero ha salido adelante con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos que ofrece diferentes productos como pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, tratamientos, polvos y cepillos para el cabello su negocio lo inicio hace mas de 2 años, poco a poco ha venido trabajando con ayuda de Dios y las personas que la quieren. Para tener más ganancias y tener otro estilo de ingresos ella también les brinda consejos a sus clientes de cómo aplicarse sus productos. Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materia prima pues actualmente tiene bastante pedidos. En el futuro quiere su negocio sea más grande para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Ángela Maritza lives in a populated area.  She is not married, but she has managed to get ahead with her child.  She sells cosmetics, offering a variety of products such as nail polish, lipstick, treatments, powders and hairbrushes.  She started her business more than 2 years ago, and this has gradually given her an occupation, thanks to God and the people who care for her.  To have more income and another means of making money, she also provides advice to her customers on how to apply their products.  With this loan, she wants to buy merchandise, since she currently has sufficient orders.  In the future, she wants her business to be bigger so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: working capital to buy beauty products

loans.name: Iveth Carolina

texts.es:
Iveth de 30 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó a comprar víveres para venderlos a sus vecinos, pero como necesitaba mas ingresos tubo que gastar sus ahorros en enlatados y así tener mas ingresos. Trabaja con ayuda de su hija desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Para seguir con su negocio ya que su casa es de caña y quiere mejoras necesita comprar bebidas, entados y arroz para así tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Iveth, 30, has a small store in the front part of her house.  She lives in a neighborhood called "Duran," on the outskirts of the city where the natural ecology is fast disappearing.  

To help with the family expenses, she started to buy groceries to sell to her neighbors, but she had to spend her savings on canned goods so that she could have a better income.  She works with the help of her daughter from 6am until 10pm.  

To continue with her business, since her house is made of cane and in need of repair, she needs to buy drinks, canned goods and rice so that she can increase her income.  In the future she wants to expand her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Mwashamba

texts.en:
Mwashamba is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She is a food vendor and for the past six years has sold samosas to her neighbors and passersby. In her business, she faces a major challenge of theft.  She has a second source of income from real estate rental housing. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwashamba hopes to own a well-furnished house in the future.  She is working with Yehu to get a loan to renovate her house. The house she lives in has electricity and piped water. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to renovate this house, purchase cement, sand and paintings.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Skeeter

texts.en:
Skeeter is a single woman with three children who attend primary school. She has been preparing and selling chapati (flatbread) at her home for two years. Her typical customers are schoolchildren and her neighbors.  Her sales fluctuate with the seasons, as she sells less when schoolchildren are on vacation in the months of April, August and December. 

She would like to buy iron sheets and plywood to construct a shelter for her business.  She currently rents a house with electricity and piped water.

Skeeter decided to work with Yehu  to get access to loans that would improve her business and her standards of living. She hopes to manage a well-furnished cafeteria in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and plywood

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Maria M. G. de 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Santiago. Tiene casa propia de material noble. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros enseres menores. Su esposo es obrero de campo y trabaja en un fundo de la zona hace varios años. La Sra. Carmen requiere el crédito para capital de trabajo. Su sueño segun nos comenta es mejorar su negocio para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Carmen está muy agradecida por la ayuda que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Carmen Maria M. G. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in the Santiago district.  She has her own home made of solid materials.  She sells clothing and other small items.  Her husband is a field hand and has worked on a farm in the area for several years.  Carmen needs a loan for working capital.  She tells us that her dream is to improve her business so that she can have a better quality of life.  Carmen is very grateful for the help that we are able to provide her through this loan.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Aurora Isabel

texts.es: Aurora Isabel tiene su negocio que es la venta de discos y películas en Dvd, es una joven muy emprendedora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante con su familia. Este negocio fue para sufragar los gastos de su hogar, ella pasa muchas necesidades pues algunas veces no logra vender mucho y no le ajusta para comprar comida para su hogar. Todos los días sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio grande y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Aurora Isabel has a business selling CD's and DVD movies.  She is a hard-working young woman that has always enjoyed working and helping her family move ahead.  Her business began as a means of defraying her household costs and while she even denies many basic necessities, sometimes she doesn't sell enough to buy food for her household.  Every day, she goes out selling her different products.  With the loan, she wants to purchase more merchandise and in the future, she wants to have a big business and be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 42 years old, married with four children who are between five and 13 years old.  Veneranda has owned a shop where she sells a variety of goods as the picture indicates.  She has been in this business for about 3 years and her shop is open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Veneranda needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will hopefully purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, different kinds of flours, cooking oil, etc... With these additional foodstuffs for sale, Veneranda will hopefully earn more profits than previously.  These profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her business and in addition to that, she will keep improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, different kinds of flours, cooking oil,etc

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 42 years old and he is married with six children who are between 4 and 16 years old.  Jean Damascene is commonly known in the business of selling goats and this is his 6th successful year in this business at which he works from 6 am to 5 pm every day.

Jean Damascene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once accorded this loan, Jean Damascene will buy additional goats so as to increase the goat sales per day.  Once these sales increase, he will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will hopefully allow him to start the business of selling cows.  By using this loan, Jean has a goal of a better lifestyle for his family and keeping saving for his family's future.

loans.use: More goats to fatten for sale

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman with three children all of whom graduated from school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites her rent bill and food as her greatest monthly expenses. 

For over twenty years, she has been weaving mats (makuti) using coconut palm leaves. She sells the mats to hoteliers who use them in thatching their roofs. Dama's major challenge is transportation. The weaving mats are transported from rural areas to urban areas for resale. She hopes to own a house in the future. 

Dama decided to join Yehu to get a loan and improve her business. With the 20,000 KES she wants to start another business of selling dried fish.

loans.use: To start another business of selling dried fish.

loans.name: Diana Janneth

texts.es: Diana C. de 37 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1, 7 y 10 años; ella tiene un negocio de confección de ropa deportiva para adultos, con el que sueña verlo crecer como una gran empresa. Desde el año 2006 estudió diseño, corte y confección de ropa en un instituto técnico y en el año 2008, después de estudiar su idea,  emprendió su negocio, comprando una máquina familiar e iniciando sus labores en  su pequeño apartamento. Con su trabajo disciplinado y responsable, poco a poco fue aumentando su capital hasta llegar a tener 5 maquinas semiindustriales y ganar el mercado de su barrio, teniendo en cuenta que tiene una gran competencia de talleres que allí realizan sus operaciones. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que se acercó estimulada por su oferta de servicios, pues quiere adicionar una maquina industrial, para mejorar su proceso de acabado y los tiempos de producción. Su sueño es ampliar el  taller, buscando una oferta de productos que llame la atención de clientes potenciales, ubicados en otras zonas de la localidad a los cuales aun no ha llegado. Su principal desafío fue ganar el mercado del sector, pues está rodeada de tres talleres y está ubicada frente a un importante  centro comercial , donde hay buenas vías de acceso y es un  punto estratégico  para el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Diana C. is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children of the following ages: 1, 7, and 10 years old.  She makes adult sports clothes, which she hopes to watch grow into a large company.  Since 2006, she studied design, cut, and tailoring at a technical college.  In 2008, after investigating her idea, she started her own business, purchasing a domestic sewing machine and beginning her work in her tiny apartment.  With discipline and responsibility, her capital began increasing little by little until she owned 5 semi-industrial sewing machines and dominated her neighborhood's market, keeping in mind that there is a lot of competition from other nearby workshops.  Currently, she is seeking her first financial loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that she felt encouraged to join for their available services.  She wants to add an industrial sewing machine in order to improve the finishing on her pieces and their production time.  Her dream is to expand her workshop and to offer a selection of products that capture the attention of potential clients located in other areas of her locality that have yet to know about her business.  Her main challenge has been winning her sector's market since she is surrounded by three other workshops.  Nonetheless, she is situated in front of an important shopping center, where there are accessible means of reaching her business and serve as a strategic point for its growth.

loans.use: Purchase machinery to improve the finishing touches on her pieces and their production and completion time.

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 23 years old, and she is married with two children.  Providence owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods as her picture indicates.  Providence has owned this shop since 2009 and the business hours are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Providence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will purchase a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and some pastries for sale.  As these foodstuffs are highly demanded by a large number of her customers, she really hopes that her revenue will increase and she also hopes that the lifestyle of her family will also improve.

loans.use: A variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and some pastries for resale

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Alegría se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Calle Naviadad- Guayaibi. 
El comité se denomina La Alegria están en el sexto Ciclo con 11 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
Cada señora de los comités se dedica a deferentes actividades para contar con ingresos extras para el bienestar de sus  familias.
Así la señora Prisila se dedica  a la venta de productos de uso domésticos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para algunos gastos personales que tiene con su familia, además desea comprar calzados a sus hijos para la escuela y algunos útiles que les falta.
texts.en: The committee, La Alegría, began with the joining of various neighbors from the community of Calle Naviadad-Guayaibi.  This committee is in its sixth cycle with eleven members.  It is a group that is known in its neighborhood for being very close, supportive, and responsible.  The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit as they dedicate every day to payments and intend to finish this stage fulfilling the institution's responsibilities.  Every woman in the committee is dedicated to different economic activities in order to generate extra income for the well-being of their families.  For example, the señora Prisila sells domestic, household products.  She is seeking a loan for some personal costs related to her family.  She would like to buy shoes for her children for school and other items that they need.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and cover other educational expenses.

loans.name: Simonia

texts.en:
Simonia is 28 years old and is single. She takes care of one dependent who is 10 years old.

Simonia is a businesswoman and has two years of experience. She owns a small business selling various styles of clothes and she says that this business is profitable, the reason why she chose it as her main activity. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day except Saturday.

Simonia is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. This will make her more efficient and more effective and successful.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alioza

texts.es: Alioza tiene 43 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. La actividad cotidiana de Aliosa, es la aplicación de bordados en polos de algodón, actividad que le dedica toda su atención, ya que requiere de mucho cuidado y precisión, a la semana elabora de 20  a 30 polos, dependiendo del diseño y del tamaño. Una vez terminada este trabajo, son comercializados, pero primero pasa por un revisado exhaustivo para su compra, depende de ello que pueda recibir las ganancias que espera, ya que dichas prendas serán exportadas. Lo que más le gusta de este trabajo, es que lo realiza en su casa, de esa manera no descuida a su hija. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y por tanto espera convertirse en una gran distribuidora, para así lograr aumentar sus ingresos económicos y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Es su  octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito que necesita, será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará hilos, lana, lentejas y mostacillas como adornos, para realizar los detalles que demandan sus bordados.
texts.en: Alioza is 43 years old and is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 children. Alioza's daily activity is embroidering cotton polo shirts. She dedicates all of her attention to this activity because it requires a lot of care and precision. She completes 20 to 30 polo shirts a week, depending on the size and design. Once the work is finished the shirts are sold but first they go through a comprehensive purchase review that determines the amount she will receive since these shirts are exported. What she enjoys most about this work is that she can do it at home which allows her to stay with her daughter. She has been doing this work for 2 years and hopes to become a great distributor so that she can increase her income and provide her children a good education. This is her 8th loan with field partner MFP. She knows that the loan that she needs will greatly benefit her in developing her business. She is also a very responsible member in her community group which is why she is very respected. With the loan she is requesting she will buy thread, wool, beads and sequins as ornaments to complete the detailing that her embroidery demands.

loans.use: Purchase thread, wool and beads for her embroidery.

loans.name: Julia Amanda

texts.es: Julia tiene su negocio que es un consultorio médico,  en donde asisten muchos clientes y enfermos. Ella es Madre de 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella inicio este negocio con fondos propios, está ubicado en su casa de habitación pues no tenía trabajo y necesitaba buscar un medio para mantener a su familia por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y que ha sobrevivido con circunstancias muy difíciles que con el paso del tiempo ha logrado superar. Este crédito es el primero y lo realiza para la compra de camillas, materiales para su consultorio, entre otras cosas. Sueña con ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y además mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Julia works as a medical consultant where she assists many patients.  She is a mother of two minors that are under her care.  She began this business with her own savings and operates it out of her house.  She started it because she didn't have work and needed to find a means to support her family.  She is a fighter and has survived many difficult circumstances that she has overcome with the passing of time.  This credit is her first and she would use it to purchase cots and materials for her clinic, amongst other things.  She dreams of offering good services to her clients and even improving their quality of life.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 32 years old and is married with two children who are 1 and 5 years old.

Fabien has owned a motorcycle since 2005 which he uses for his transportation business. He is very proud of his motorcycle as it allows him to earn money for taking care of his family.

Although Fabien has owned his motorcycle for about five years, his savings are still too low to buy another motorcycle. To solve this problem, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. Added to his savings, this loan will hopefully allow him to buy another motorcycle.

With this second motorcycle, Fabien really hopes that his profits, as well as his savings, will be improved.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Nelly Angelica

texts.es:
Nelly de 55 años,  vende ropa que confecciona, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.  

Cuando su esposo falleció ella tubo que hacerse cargo de sus dos hijos pero como no tenia suficiente dinero decidió invertir sus últimos ahorros en telas y una maquina de coser para confeccionar pantalones, camisas. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo vender la ropa que ella mismo hacia. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am vendiendo su propia ropa. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas para hacer mas ropa y venderlas. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio de ropa bien surtido y que sus hijos tengan éxito en el ámbito profesional.
texts.en: Nelly is 55 years old and sells clothing that she makes.  She lives in an urban area called "Suburbio," characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are informal vendors.  When her husband passed away, she had to take full responsibility of her two children but since she didn't have enough money, she decided to invest her last bit of savings in fabric and a sewing machine to make pants and shirts.  Little by little and with a lot of effort, she was able to sell the clothes that she made.  Since then and even now, she begins work at 8:30am selling her clothes.  With her loan, she wants to purchase, more fabric in order to make more clothes to sell.  In the future, she dreams of have her clothing business well-stocked and her children being successful in the professional world.

loans.use: Purchase fabric.

loans.name: Yeni Mercedes

texts.es: Yeni Mercedes tiene 35 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de lácteos y comercio de cerdos. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio lo inicio con su esposo con dinero que tenían ahorrado ella con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ellos asisten a una escuela por su Mama que se preocupa por proporcionarles todo los más necesario. Ella sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y proporcionar un buen servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos y leche, cremas, queso y cuajada.
texts.en: Yeni Mercedes is 35, and she buys and sells dairy products and pigs.  She has had this business that she started with her husband for more than 14 years with money that they had saved.  She has sacrificed much to get ahead since she has two young children to care for.  They go to a school that their mother takes great pains in supplying everything that they need.  She dreams of improving their standard of living and to give them a better life.  This loan will be used to buy pigs, milk, cream, cheese and cuajada (a type of cheese).

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Basilidesa

texts.es: Basilidesa, D. 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Las cosas D. negocio, fueron su mayor pasión desD. su infancia, por ello venD. todo lo que le piden sus clientes como: ropa, zapatos, sabanas, cubre camas entre otros. El gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sus vecinas la prefieran, quienes no dudan en hacer sus pedidos, sobre todo en ropas y zapatos, por la facilidad D. pagos que deja. Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio, es la modalidad D. crédito que deja y eso le permite acumular mayores ganancias que al contado. Por ello, todos los días, luego D. sus labores domesticas, visita a sus clientas, para ofrecer su mercadería o para hacer algún cobro. Su mayor  anhelo D. Basilidesa,  es instalar un bazar o asociarse con su hermana que es profesora y juntas realizar manualidades didácticas. Este es su  octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donD. es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias. Con el crédito que solicita, va invertir en la compra D. polos, pantalones, camisas entre otras ropas casuales, para atender las solicitudes D. sus clientes.
texts.en: Basilidesa is 55 years old and is a happy housewife. She lives in her own home with her husband and her 3 children. Business things have been her passion since she was a child which is why she sells everything that her clients ask for such as: clothing, shoes, sheets and bedspreads among other things. Because of her charisma and friendliness, she is preferred by her neighbors who don't hesitate in ordering shoes and clothing from her because of how easy it is to make payments to her. What she enjoys most about her business is the form of credit that she uses which allows her to make more profit than if she were selling for cash. Everyday, after she completes her housework she visits her clients to sell her merchandise or to collect a payment. Basilidesa's greatest desire is to install a bazaar or to associate herself with her sister who is a teacher and to teach crafts. This is her 8th loan with field partner MFP. She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to obtain another loan with peace of mind and without causing problems for her group where she is very liked by all the other members. With the loan she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of polo shirts, pants, shirts and other casual clothing to meet her customer's requests.

loans.use: Stock more clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Heroina Del Consuelo

texts.es: Heroína tiene 53 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de raspado. Hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con crédito para su actividad, el negocio lo inicio vendiendo en su domicilio sus clientes llegaban a comprar sus deliciosos productos con el paso del tiempo fue que adquirió sus carretones en donde sale a la calle a vender y obtiene una variedad de clientes. El crédito es para la compra de hielo, cucharas, tasas, vasos entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Heroína is 53 years old and works making and selling snow cones. She has been in this business for more than 13 years, so this isn't her first experience with getting a loan for her job. She began her business selling from her home, where her customers would arrive to buy her delicious products. As time passed, she had to acquire small carts so she could go out in the street and sell her products in order to have a variety of customers. This loan is to buy ice, spoons and cups, among other things.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is 37 years old and is married with five children who are between 6 and 16 years old.

Assia owns a public secretariat business and she has been in this business for about three years. Her services are open from 7 a.m. until late in the evening.

Assia needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more computers. With these additional computers, the number of her clients will increase as well as her profits. These profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in order to increase her business either in size or in equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ruth; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora y venta de productos de belleza en forma independiente, el negocio de fotocopiadora atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar la tienda de fotocopiadora y también poder vender los productos de belleza en la tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papales al por mayor y productos de belleza.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the KuKuli community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province and department.

The member is Ruth. She is 35 years old and is married and has four children. She alternates her daily activities between a photocopy business and selling beauty products independently. She tends to the photocopy business from 7AM until 7PM. The member wishes to improve and expand the photocopy shop and also be able to sell beauty products in the shop. She is requesting the loan to purchase paper at wholesale and beauty products.

She is thankful to those who are part of this dream through this means and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase paper at wholesale and beauty products.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama C.  est une femme mariée de 37 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle a  4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 8 ans. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par amour  mais aussi dans le but de satisfaire ses besoins d’ordre familiaux. L’aspect lucratif de cette activité l’intéresse  beaucoup. Par conséquent elle s’adonne  à l’achat et la revente d’habits et de chaussures depuis déjà  plus de 15 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2009.Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000frs qui sera destiné à accroitre son fond de roulement afin de développer son activité. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer  le cadre de vie de sa famille et d’aspirer a disposer d’un grand magasin en renforçant  son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama C. is a married woman, 37 years old, who lives in Yoff. She has four children ranging from 4 to 8 years of age. She has chosen this line of business because she was attracted to it but also because of the need to support her family. The financial aspect matters a lot to her. And so she has been selling clothing and shoes for over 15 years already. She joined the Yoff credit union in August 2009. At present she is seeking a loan of 300,000 which will be used to bolster her business capital and grow her business. The increase of her revenues will allow her to improve her family’s life conditions; eventually she hopes to have a large store and  maintain her savings.

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa, hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, sus clientes llegan a buscarla a su vivienda en donde tiene una buena parte de mercadería, ella también sale a vender todos los días  temprano,  ella es muy humorista y reconocida por su gran carisma que ofrecer. Para Karla el tener un negocio le ha representado el fortalecimiento de su independencia para su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisetas, pantalones y shorts entre otras.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa, who has been in the business of selling new and used clothes for more than 12 years, has 2 young children. Her customers arrive to find her at her house where she has the majority of her merchandise. She also goes out to sell early every morning. She has a very good sense of humor and is known for her great charisma. For Karla, having a business has represented the strengthening of her independence for her home. This loan is to buy skirts, suits, shirts, pants and shorts, among other things.

loans.use: Capital for Work

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de huevos, ella tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende los huevos desde las 7.00 a.m  hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los huevos y también poder vender productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceites. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar huevos al por mayor. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Kukuli community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and department.

The member is Cristina. She is 52 years old and is a single mother and has one child. The member alternates her daily activities between buying and selling eggs. She has a small stall where she sells eggs from 7AM until 5PM. She wishes to have a shop from which to sell the ggs and also to be able to sell products like rice, sugar, milk and oils. She is requesting the loan to purchase eggs at wholesale prices.

She is thankful to those who are part of this dream in this manner and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Fortunato Jesus

texts.es:
Fortunato de 56 años, es vendedor al po mayo y menor de arroz y pollos de criadero, su esposa se encuentra fuera del país mientras que el esta en su casa con sus hijos. vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” con caminos de tierra y montañas. 

El trabajaba en una fabrica de construcción pero debido a que necesitaba esta mas tiempo con sus hijos. Compro arroz y pollos para criarlos y después venderlos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo los quintales de arroz y sus pollos de criadero. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz y balanceado de pollos para tener mejor ingresos. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y seguir con salud.
texts.en:
Fortunato, 56, sells rice at wholesale and retail and chickens from his coop.  His wife is living outside the country, while he lives in his home with their children.  He lives in a neighborhood called "Paraiso" on the outskirts of the city that has dirt roads and mountains.  

He used to work in a factory, but since he needed more time to be with his children he bought rice and chickens to raise and later sell.  He works every day from the early morning hours until evening, selling hundred-pound bags of rice and the chickens from his coop.

With the loan he wants to buy rice and nutritionally balanced feed for his chickens to increase his income.  In the future, he wants to stay healthy and see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy rice and chickens

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha was born in 1968 and is married with one child. She also takes care of two dependent relatives.

Liberatha is a businesswoman and her husband is a driver. This family works hard so that they keep on growing in their daily activities.

Liberatha owns a store which sells various products. She has good experience in this field because this is her tenth year of successful operation. The hours of her daily activities are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day.

Liberatha is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business, which is the best way of attracting the new customers. With these new customers, she will be able to earn more profits to use in her business and for her family as well.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nidia Liz; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia tiene una tienda de artesanía que atiende desde las 8:30 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,ella vende chompas, collares y trabajos hechos en arcilla, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de artesanía. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the "Kukuli" group loan. The group is based in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province, department of Cusco. 

Nidia Liz is 35 years old and lives with her partner. Alongside her daily activities she sells crafts. She owns a craft shop that's open from 8:30am to 8pm. She sells sweaters, necklaces and simple clay pieces. She would like to expand her business and requests a loan to buy merchandise for her craft shop. 

The borrower would like to thank those helping her dream through this means, and is committed to repaying the loan on time as agreed.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for craft shop.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie was born in 1962 and is married with three children. She is a businesswoman, owning a business selling clothes while her husband works in a bank. This family works hard so that they progress with their family through providing the necessary support for their children.

Pascasie knows what she’s doing in her business because she has an experience of ten years. The hours of her business are from eight in the morning to six in the evening, every day.

Pascasie is now requesting a Kiva loan for the purpose of expanding her business; once her business is expanded, she will be able to satisfy her clients, which is one way of earning profits. With the profits expected, she will reinvest in her business and solve her family’s financial problems.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 62 años, es una madre de familia muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia  en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo, Rosalía prepara los condimentos para sazonar sus anticuchos, luego que cayera enferma varios días, dejó de atender su negocio. Es así que viene desafiando las adversidades de su salud, ya que no le gusta, estar sin hacer nada.  En la actualidad busca el apoya de su sobrina, quien atiende ahora su público, de ese modo continua con su negocio de anticuchos, que son platillos muy solicitados por sus clientes. Su negocio se encuentra bien ubicado, en la puerta de su casa, lugar donde circulan mucha gente y eso le favorece mucho en las ganancias. En adelante, piensa diversificar su negocio instalando una panadería, sin embargo debe restaurar el techo de su casa. Este su segundo crédito con MFP; y se compromete en pagar las cuotas estipuladas. Asimismo manifiesta haberse integrado a su grupo comunal y se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una parrilla, donde pueda freír todos sus anticuchos de manera más rápida.
texts.en:
Rosalia, 62, is a mother from an honest and hard-working family. She lives in her own home alongside her husband and their 4 children. With a great deal of effort, Rosalia prepares seasonings to flavour skewered meats. 

After falling ill for several days she had to shut down her business. She has since been defying the hardships derived from her health, because she does not like to be idle. At the moment, her niece helps her by serving the customers. That's how Rosalia has managed to continue her swekered meats business. Her dishes are very much in demand and her business is well located, on her doorstep, with a lot of traffic, which helps her earnings very much. In future she would like to diversify her business by installing a bakery, but first she must restore the roof of her house. 

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is comitted to repaying it as agreed. She also explains that she has fit into her loan group very well and that she gets on fine with all other members. With the requested loan she plans to buy a grill, so she can fry the skewered meat more quickly.

loans.use: Buy a grill.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 40 years old, married with two children aged one and six. Francoise takes care of one dependent who is 10 years old; this dependent is a relative. Francoise owns a business selling construction materials, however, her husband doesn’t work. Francoise has an experience of two years. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every except on Saturday.

Francoise is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more construction materials. With this expansion, Francoise will be able to satisfy her customers and to earn more profit to be used in her business and for her family as well.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Emilia  Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia Elizabeth; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pinturas cusqueñas, la socia junto con su esposo pintan cuadros cusqueños y lo venden a las diferentes tiendas artesanales en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para pintar los cuadros como pinceles, pinturas y marcos.  


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
