Ovi is 29 years old and lives with her partner Angel, who is 33. They have 3 young children, who they love and care for with great affection. They live in a rented house in the town of Patay.  

Every morning, Ovi wakes up early to fix breakfast for her children, who are in school. She spends the rest of the day caring for the fields where she grows food. Ever since she was a little girl she has learned to work the land - "agriculture is part of who I am", she says. She got her own land to cultivate some six years ago and now she has enough money to invest in the purchase of more seeds, in order to increase its profitability. 

Ovi grows peas, potatoes and gladiolus. In two months she will harvest two hectares [almost 5 acres] of peas, and she already has buyers in the town's central market. The high quality of her vegetables has meant high demand and more profits. In a few years she will be able to acquire more land and build her own house. 

This is Ovi's fourth loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner], and the communal bank that she belongs to has a very high level of savings. She feels both happy and accomplished as a part of this communal bank. Ovi will use the current loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the pea fields that she will soon harvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Luz M. A. tiene 27 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Tate.
La Sra. Maria trabaja en el centro comercial Plaza Vea como ayudante de cocina. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañileria. La Sra. Maria requiere el crédito para terminar algunos acabados en su vivienda y poder formar su propio negocio de cocina en su vivienda. La Sra. Ana está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Maria is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Tate. She works in the Plaza Vea commercial center as a kitchen helper. Her husband works as a masonry assistant. She is requesting the loan to finish some projects on her home so she can open her own cooking business out of it. Maria is very thankful for the support you are providing her with through this loan.

loans.use: Make improvements on her home

loans.name: Roberta Eunice

texts.es:
Roberta Eunice R. B.
Roberta es de 31 años de edad, soltera, se dedica a la fabricación de canastos plásticos, en la actividad tiene 8 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para la incrementar su capital, es factible autorizar a la solicitante, en virtud que la misma es utilizada mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Según referencia de la solicitante es una persona responsable, Por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Roberta is 31 years old, single and has made a living making plastic baskets for the past eight years. She is requesting her first loan to increase her capital. It is practicable to approve the loan, since it will help her improve her living conditions. According to a reference, Roberta is a responsible person, so she should not have difficulties making her payments.

loans.use: Buy materials to make her products

loans.name: Daisy Del Carmen

texts.es: Daisy del Carmen Carcamo de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, el mayor va a la universidad y el menor estudia educación básica. Daisy posee una venta de carne de res y de cerdo, la cual esta ubicada en el área carnes en el mercado #1 de Ahuachapán, departamento en el cual reside junto a su familia. Desde hace 20 años que ella posee este negocio, en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo y que les brinda ventas bastante aceptables, por lo que Daisy desea poder  invertir, comprando mayor cantidad de carne, chorizos, salchichas, carne de cerdo, chuletas y toda una variedad de productos alimenticios. Esto lo hace con el deseo de incrementar sus ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable junto a su familia.
texts.en: Daisy del Carmen C. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children, who are students.  The older one is in college and the younger one is in elementary school.  Daisy has a business selling beef and pork which is located in the meat area of the Mercado #1 of Ahuachapán, the department in which she lives with her family.  She has had the business for 20 years and works with her husband.  It provides them with good sales, which is why Daisy wants to invest more, purchasing more meat, sausages, pork, cutlets, and a variety of food products.  She does this with the desire to increase her earning and this way, have a more stable life with her family.

loans.use: To purchase beef and pork.

loans.name: 2671 (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 2761 esta formado por señoras que se conocen y son de diferentes lugares de la ciudad y cantones de Cuenca, pero se han reunido con un fin en común que es  realizar los créditos para invertir en sus pequeños negocios y así crecer día a día con su trabajo para mejorar su situación económica y entregar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir.

La Señora Ana Llivigañay vive en la comunidad de Zhumir que  pertenece al cantón Paute, este es el  primer crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir y ha sido invitada por su amiga de la comunidad a formar parte de este banco comunal. Nuestra socia  trabaja en un invernadero que es de su propiedad en donde siembra tomates, esta labor la realiza hace 15 años y su producto lo vende en el mercado de Paute y  tiene clientes fijos a quienes entrega. También se dedica a la cría de animales como chanchos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su propia comunidad.
Doña Ana tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos  de 29, 27, 23, 21, 19, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos son casados y vive  independientemente, su quinto hijo trabaja y es solo para sus gastos personales y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela.  Su esposo no se encuentra en el país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Tiene casa propia fruto del trabajo conyugal.  Su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. 
Su meta es construir una nueva casa por el centro del cantón Paute. 

La Señora Gladys C. vive en la comunidad de Zhumir  que  pertenece al cantón Paute, tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 21, 20, 17, 16, 14, 12, 10 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos estudian en el colegio, a excepción de su cuarta hija que no le gusta  estudiar  pero ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad.
Su esposo trabaja fuera del país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Tienen casa propia que es el resultado del trabajo conyugal.
Doña Gladis se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes, los que vende en su propia comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Trabaja también todos los días en  una hacienda en donde se dedica a la agricultura cultivando hortalizas. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.

Su meta es  mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank 2761 consists of women from different places in the city and surrounding area of Cuenca who know each other. They have united with a common goal which is to acquire loans to invest in their small businesses and in this way grow every day through their work to improve their economic situation and provide a better future for their children.

Ana Llivigañay lives in Zhumir, Paute; this is her first loan through Espoir and she was invited by her friend in the community to join this communal bank. Our member works in her own greenhouse where she grows tomatoes. She has done this for 15 years and she sells her product in the Paute market and she has some regular customers to whom she delivers. She also raises animals like pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs that she sells in her own community.

Ana is 43 years old, married, and has 7 children ages 29, 27, 23, 21, 19, 13, and 9 years old. Her first four children are married and live on their own, her fifth child works and is responsible for his personal expenses, and her last two children are in school. Her husband is not in the country, he has migrated in search of a better job to help their household expenses. She has her own house because of their hard work. She is going to invest the loan in buying chickens and feed.

Her goal is to build a new house in the center of Paute. 

Gladys C. lives in Zhumir, Paute; she is 39 years old, married, and has 7 children ages  21, 20, 17, 16, 14, 12, and 10. Her four children are in school, except for the fourth daughter who doesn’t like to study, but she helps with the household chores. Her youngest two children study in a community school.

Her husband works outside of the country; he migrated to seek a better future for their children. They have their own house which is the result of their hard work.

Gladys raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs which she sells in her own community when she has some economic need to do so. She also works everyday on a farm where crops are grown. This is her first credit with the foundation and she is going to invest it in buying chickens and feed.

Her goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: Buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Judith Mariuxi

texts.es:
Judith tiene una tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo de Guayaquil la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Hace un año atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y con la ayuda de su mama que también tiene una tienda pudo surtirla, poco a poco la ha venido incrementando con verduras y vegetales. Con la ayuda de su mama a podido tener sus propios ingresos y darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos. 

Pero ahora quiere surtir mas su negocio comprando con el préstamo aceite, arroz y bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén de víveres para poder cubrir con los gastos que afrontan sus hijos.
texts.en:
Judith has a shop in the front part of her house. She lives in the urban district called Guasmo de Guayquil, where the majority of the inhabitants are informal business people.

She began her grocery store a year ago, since there wasn't one in her sector. With the aid of her mother, who also has a shop, she was able to stock it, and little by little she has been increasing her stock of greens and vegetables. With her mother's help, she has been able to have her own income and give a better life to her two children.

But now she wants to stock her business with more items, using the loan to buy oil, rice, and beverages.  In the future she wants to have a larger store to be able to cover the expenses that her children present.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, rice, oil, and beverages

loans.name: Ana Gloria De María

texts.es: Ana Gloria D. María A. D. G. D. 46 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas menores D. edad, junto a quienes resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ana posee un negocio en el cual comercializa huevos, y así mismo cuenta con una pequeña tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Es gracias a este negocio como ella le brinda ayuda económica a su esposo y D. esta manera pueden vivir D. una forma más estable. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar huevos por mayor y D. esta manera obtenerla a precios más bajos, así también espera comprar productos para la tienda y así surtir su negocio, el cual le brinD. mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria D. María A. D. G. is 46 years old and is a hard working and responsible mother with good references from her neighbors.  She lives with her husband and two young daughters in the Cuscatlán department.

Ana has a business where she sells eggs from a small store where she also sells other perishable food items.  The store is located within her home.  Thanks to this business, she is able to help her husband proviD. for the family financially, allowing them to live a more stable life.

Ana is asking for this loan so that she can buy eggs in larger quantities, so that she can buy them for lower prices.  She also wants to buy other products so that she can stock her store to and raise her profits.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of propane gas cylinders

loans.name: Carmen Hilaria

texts.es:
Carmen Hilaria P. T.

Carmen es de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón y tres mujeres, es costurera, actualmente se dedica a vender productos de consumo diario,  en la actividad tiene 8 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito  para ampliar el capital de su tienda, la misma es una inversión rentable y la solicitante, posee la capacidad para realizar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en: Carmen Hilaria P. T. is 50 years old, married, and has a son and three daughters.  She is a seamstress, but she currently sells daily consumer products.  Carmen has eight years of experience in this business.  She is requesting her first loan so that she can increase the capital for her store.  Carmen views this opportunity as a profitable investment and has the ability to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Asociacion De Todas Las Sangres Group

texts.es: La señora Soledad tiene 33 años es conviviente y vive en la zona b de Huaycan, es la nueva presidenta del grupo “Asociación de todas las Sangres” el cual se conforma por 10 vecinas amigas que llevan trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 4 meses, comenzó a trabajar hace 5 años vendiendo comidas y cambio este negocio al nacer su hijo, ahora vende verduras como alverjas y habas. Ha comprado con el ultimo préstamo un repostero y también invirtió en la mercadería de venta, aunque espera poner su propio taller de confección de prendas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pero para eso necesita que Edaprospo haga más habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Soledad is 33 years old and lives with her partner in Zone B of Huaycan. She is the new president of “Asociación de todas las Sangres” group, which is made up of 10 friends who are all neighbors. They have been working with Edaprospo for 4 months. 

For 5 years, Soledad sold food. She changed her business when her child was born, and now sells vegetables like peas and broad beans. With her last loan, she bought a confectioner and merchandise to sell retail. She hopes to someday set up her own tailoring workshop and improve her family's quality of life, but for those goals she needs Edaprospo to approve her for larger loans.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & hair accessories

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de Los Ángeles R. C. de 53 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es soltera, la cual nunca tuvo hijos, por lo que vive sola en su casa propia. María posee un chalet en el cual comercializa desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo golosinas, jugos, bebidas calientes, comidas típicas como pupusas y tamales y otros productos más. La ubicación del negocio es muy buena ya que se encuentra rodeada de varios negocios y empresas gubernamentales, por lo que a diario hay una gran cantidad de personas que llegan a su chalet a comer, situación la cual María desea aprovechar al máximo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y así mismo comprar más bebidas y golosinas, de tal forma que atienda a más personas y así mismo que perciba mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María de Los Ángeles R. C. is 53 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. She is single and never had children, so she lives in her own home by herself. María has an open-air café where she sells breakfast and lunch. She also offers sweets, juices, hot beverages, traditional foods such as pupusas and tamales, and other dishes. Her business is situated in a good location since it is surrounded by different businesses and government offices. A large number of people come to her café every day to eat, a situation of which Maria wants to take full advantage. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of ingredients for preparing her dishes as well as acquire more beverages and sweets. This will allow her to serve more people and generate better earnings as a result.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes, beverages, and sweets

loans.name: María Lydia

texts.es: María Lydia C. de 56 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután en donde vive junto a su compañero de vida, el cual le ayuda en el negocio. María es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, quien posee una venta de tortillas, así mismo una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, y un molino, negocios gracias a los cuales logra sostener su hogar. Ella es una persona muy esforzada y dedicada a lo que se hace para ganarse el sustento diario. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en primer lugar en la tienda, comprando todos los productos de primera necesidad como alimenticios y para el cuidado del hogar, así mismo para invertir en repuestos para su molino y por ultimo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para elaborar las tortillas. María desea mucho mejorar la estabilidad de sus negocio y de esta forma vivir mejor junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
María Lydia C. is 56 years old and resides in Jiquilisco, Department of Usulután, with her lifetime companion who helps with her business. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who manages a tortilla stand, a store that sells basic necessities, and a grain mill. Thanks to these businesses, she is able to provide for her household. María is a determined and dedicated individual who does whatever it takes to earn a living each day.

She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to invest in her store. María plans to buy staples such as food and household products. In addition, she will acquire spare parts for her grain mill. Finally, she will buy a large quantity of corn for making tortillas. María greatly wants to improve the stability of her businesses so that she and her husband can live better.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store, corn for making tortillas, and spare parts for her grain mill

loans.name: María Inés Moreno

texts.es: María Inés M. de 31 años de edad, reside en la zona rural de Suchitoto, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán, ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad. María trabaja junto a su esposo en su propia parcela sembrando maíz para posteriormente comercializar, ganancias las cuales representan la única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia, así mismo María posee algunas vacas de las cuales obtiene productos lácteos como leche y queso para el consumo de la familia. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar dos novillas para criarlas y posteriormente obtener los mayores recursos de ellas, así mismo ella desea comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para incrementar su cosecha y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Inés M. is 31 years old and resides in the rural district of Suchitoto in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband and their three young children. María and her husband own a parcel of land where they grow corn to sell at a later time. Their earnings from this activity is the only source of income by which they support their family. María also owns cows from which she is able to obtain milk for family consumption and for making cheese.

She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money needed to buy two young heifers. This will allow her to obtain more milk in the future. She also wants to buy more corn so that she can increase her yield and generate more earnings.

loans.use: Purchase corn & two heifers

loans.name: Wilson Fernando

texts.es: El Sr Wilson vive en la avenida 2 de agosto junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas en la casa de su madre, es un hombre muy trabajador además un cliente antiguo de Emprender que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, Su actividad es la de transporte de pasajeros cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual lo trabaja como taxi todos los días el lleva y trae a sus hijas del colegio , También cuenta con un Bar- Rokola el cual funciona los días viernes, sábados  y domingos que lo atiende por las noches. En si el crédito que necesita es para reparar su vehículo , cambiar motor . El Sr Wilson esta en planes de comprar una casa propia para así brindarles a sus hijitas comodidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilson lives with his wife and two daughters at his mother’s house located along August 2nd Avenue. He is a hardworking gentleman who has been a longtime client of Emprender, having demonstrated that he is responsible and prompt with his payments. His business involves providing passenger transportation services, utilizing his own vehicle as a taxi. Every day he takes his daughters to and from school. Wilson also has a jukebox that he operates on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday evenings.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his vehicle and replace the motor. Sr. Wilson plans to buy his own house so that his daughters will be more comfortable.

loans.use: Repair his vehicle & replace the motor

loans.name: Ramiro Jose

texts.es: El señor Ramiro Jose C. C., tiene la edad de 49 años es casado, su esposa es agricultora, tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que los mayores trabajan y apoyan a  sus padres en los gastos que se incurren en el hogar, Don Ramiro es también agricultor con más de 13 años de experiencia, y han batallado en sus terrenos con problemas de sequia, plagas de roedores e insectos, fue gracias a la reforma agraria que pudieron de los 90’s que lograron adquirir sus terrenos, el préstamo lo solicitan para la compra de materiales agrícolas que favorezcan a un buen mantenimiento fitosanitario de sus terrenos, y favorezca a corto plazo a un aumento en las ventas, que brinde un continuo mejoramiento a las condiciones económicas en las que habitan en la actualidad, sobre todo para tener los recursos económicos para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios profesionales que permitan a ellos un desarrollo económico-social y el de sus futuras familias.
texts.en: Mr. Ramiro Jose C. C. is 49 years old. He is married and his wife is a farmer. They have 3 teenage children. The oldest ones work and help their parents with the household expenses. Ramiro is also a farmer with more than 13 years of experience. They have struggled on their land with problems of drought and rodent and insect invasions.  It was thanks to the agrarian reform of the 90's  that they were able to acquire their land. The loan that they are asking for will be to buy agricultural materials that will help maintain the plant health on their land, as well as lead to increased sales after a short time. This will result in a continuous improvement in the financial conditions they live in presently. Above all, this is to have the financial resources to support their children in their professional studies which will allow them and their future families to have socio-economic development.

loans.use: Maintenance of his land

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El señor Martin es soltero vive en la comunidad Tacuarembo a 30 km. De la carretera San Luis el vive con su señora madre y su hermana en la cual ellos están pendiente de el pero mas se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, cría Cerdos y se dedica a la venta de animales  por que vende hasta 12 torillos anual, también siembra maíz y guarda forraje para sus animales de todo lo que el siembra, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la siembra y preparado de la tierra, también para la compra de alimento mejorado para sus animales, es muy trabajador el solo mantiene a su familia esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado..
texts.en:
Sr. Martin is single and lives along Km30 of the San Luis Highway in the community of Tacuarembo with his mother and sister. He raises pigs and cattle, selling up to twelve young bulls each year. Martin also grows corn and fodder for his animals, which is basically everything that he plants.

The money from this loan will be used to prepare his land for planting crops. He will also buy better feed for his animals. Martin works very hard because he is the only one supporting his family. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Pay to have his land prepared for growing corn & purchase feed for his animals

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Tiene 1 hijo de 9 años a su cargo, el se encarga de ser una padre responsable, para que su hijo obtenga lo necesario. El ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma   ya que el siempre está pendiente de sus pagos. Este crédito es para realizar mejoras a su camión que lo ocupan en diferentes tareas.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time, so this is not the first time he has received financing. He has been providing transportation services for more than thirteen years. Jorge has a nine year old son who is a dependent. Being a responsible father, Jorge wants to provide everything his son needs.

He has demonstrated that he completes his payments in a timely manner and always handles them with care. This loan will be used to make repairs to his truck, which is used for different tasks.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio nacido en Chuquisaca. El vive con doña Felicia tienen 2 hijos chicos que todavía no estudian ni trabajan el se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, siembra maíz y maní ese es su trabajo fuerte por que el a vista que es el producto que mas le renta por que el lo vende en su terreno sin pagar pasajes, es muy trabajador el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para el preparado de la tierra y la siembra de los productos que el Sr. Vende, también se dedica a la cría  de animales, los engorada y los vende en el mercado de la zona, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado..
texts.en:
Sr. Octavio was born in Chuquisaca. He lives with Doña Felicia and their two sons who are neither studying nor working. Octavio is a farmer and rancher. He works hard growing corn and peanuts since these are the most profitable crops. Octavio sells his crops directly from his land so that he does not have to pay shipping costs. He is an extremely hard worker.

The loan he is requesting will be used to prepare his land for growing the products he sells. Octavio also raises and fattens animals to sell at the local market. He is very grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Pay to have his land prepared for growing corn and peanuts

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y a pesar de los inconvenientes que pasa está feliz de tener a su hijo Smith de 4 añitos, él es su razón de vivir; ambos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad de Cahuide). Desde muy niña se dedicó a la siembra de café; sus padres le enseñaron cultivarla y cuidarla; con el pasar del tiempo ella aprendió ahorrar para poder tener su propio terreno de cultivo; donde comenzó sembrando plátano; los cuales vende a un comerciante de la misma zona, ahora ella viaja al mercado central de su ciudad, para ofrecer café. Miriam no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie pero eso no le atemoriza, sino al contrario le da fuerzas para salir adelante, pues está segura que con esfuerzo y optimismo; logrará sacar adelante a su hijo. En adelante, piensa abrir una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y así poder ayudar habitantes de su localidad, ya que no existe una tienda similar y la lejanía con la ciudad, impide la compra de los productos de consumo diario. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y señala que desde que empezó a trabajar con su banco comunal, siente su progreso, por eso piensa integrarse más con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 40 sacos de abono, para el café que esta sembrando lo cual asciende a la suma de dos mil nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 24 years old, single mother.  In spite of the inconveniences of being a single mother, she is happy to have her son Smith, who is 4 years old.  He is her reason for living.  They both live in a rented house located in the Peruvian jungle (in the town of Cahuide).  Since she was a young girl she has grown coffee.  Her parents taught her how to cultivate it and care for it.  With time, she learned to save in order to purchase a piece of land to farm.  She started growing bananas and sold them to a merchant in her same region and now, she travels to the central market in the city to sell her coffee.  Miriam has no one to help her, but this doesn't discourage her.  On the contrary, it gives her strength to strive to get ahead since she is sure that with hard work and optimism she will be able to provide for her son.  

Her plans are to open a store that sells basic necessities to be able to help the residents of her town since there isn't one there and they are far from the city.  This prevents them from being able to purchase goods daily.  This is her third loan with MFP and she notes that since she has started working with her communal bank she has been able mark her progress.  For this reason she plans to integrate more with them.  She will use the 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting to buy 40 bags of fertilizer for the coffee that she is planting

loans.use: To purchase 40 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Las Mellisa Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Mellisa está conformado por Maria Josefa y Martha Lorena. Ambas tienen las mismas actividades económicas como es la venta de productos Avon, son mujeres muy responsables y se han unido para mejorar las condiciones de sus negocios. Maria Josefa sale todos los días de su vivienda para vender sus productos, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las tareas diarias del hogar, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Es por eso que juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para invertir en la compra de materia prima necesaria pues ambas tienen demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Las Mellisa” consists of Maria Josefa and Martha Lorena. Both ladies have the same type of business, selling Avon products. They are responsible women who have joined together to improve the condition of their businesses.

Maria Josefa leaves home every day so that she can sell her products, so she must wake up early to complete her daily household chores. She has three young children who are in her care. For this reason, she has decided to request this loan so that she can invest in merchandise. Both of them experience demand from their customers that they must meet.

loans.use: Operating capital for buying merchandise

loans.name: Carla Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Carla vive en la localidad de el Torno, de la ciudad de santa cruz, es nacida en el departamento, su actividad es la venta de medicamentos naturales, hace dos año que se dedica a esta actividad,  es madre soltera tiene un hijo pequeño, por lo cual es el único ingreso que sustenta a su familia, vive en la casa de sus padres, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio, le va muy bien en esta actividad ya que muchas personas compran medicamentos caseros o naturales, ella vende desde tempranas horas de la mañana, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla lives in the neighborhood of El Torno in the city of Santa Cruz. She was born in the same department. Carla has been selling natural medicines for two years. She is a single mother with a small child and this is the only source of income by which she supports her family. Carla lives at her parents’ house.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business. Carla has done very well with her business since many people buy home remedies and natural medicines. She begins selling in the early morning hours and appreciates Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase natural medicines

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Julia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia y el otro aun es pequeño, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende pollos y huevos, que compra de las avícolas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevo.
Julia sueña con tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Qaytu”, which means “Thread of Gold” in Quechua. She is in a common law marriage and has two children, one who is in school and another who is an infant. Julia has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells chickens and eggs. She buys the poultry and manages her business every day.

Julia needs a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of eggs. She dreams of opening a grocery store and owning a home since she currently lives in a rental house.

loans.use: Purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María ella tiene 54 años de edad y esta soltera pero tiene dos hijos de una relación que tuvo hace varios años atrás. Ellos a pesar que son mayores de edad aun viven con ella y además estudian en la universidad.

Tiene un taller de costura y un pequeño bazar donde además de coser y vender sus propios vestidos también vende toda clase de artículos de bazar, le encanta confeccionar ropa de mujer, aunque también elabora ropa de niños, trabaja todos los días de 8am hasta las 20h00, a veces trabaja hasta mas tarde por los trabajos que tenga que entregar,  ella compra las telas y los artículos de bazar a un señor el cual le cancela a fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y otros artículos que se venden en el bazar. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando y construir otro piso en su casa.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the Su Bankito communal bank meets every two weeks.  

Here we find Maria. She is 54 years old and single. She has two children from a relationship from many years ago. Despite being adults, they still live with her and are in college.

She has a sewing workshop and a small variety store, where besides sewing and selling her own dresses, she also sells all kinds of items. She likes to make women's clothing, although she also makes children's clothing.  She works every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. Sometimes she works later because of the orders she has to deliver. She purchases the fabric and the store items from a man who collects from her at the end of the month.   

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric and other items that are sold in the store.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes the ease in obtaining loans. 
 
Her goals are to continue working and to build another floor on her house.

loans.use: To buy fabric and variety store items.

loans.name: Leslie Ricardo

texts.es: La señora Leslie Ricardo M. M., tiene 32 años habita acompañada de su pareja de vida, tiene dos hijos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar la escuela secundaria, ellos son agricultores con más de 18 años de experiencia en los que han batallado con enfermedades de plagas, sequias, y es precisamente por esta razón que solicito un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que favorezcan a un mantenimiento optimo de sus terrenos, aumento en la producción e incremento en las ventas de sus cultivos, que permita mejores condiciones económicas para la incursión a nuevos mercados y/o negocios que favorezcan al desarrollo económico y social de sus hijos. Sus hijos están pequeños y es su plan familiar tener los recursos con años de anticipación para sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en: Leslie Ricardo M. M. is 32 years old. She lives with her life's companion and she has two minor children who are in high school. They are farmers with more than 18 years of experience. They have struggled with pest invasions and drought and that is the reason that she has applied for a loan. It will be used to buy agricultural materials for optimal maintenance of their land and to increase the production and crop sales. This will allow better financial conditions to go into new markets and/ or businesses that will favor the financial and social development of their children. Their children are still young and the family plan is to have the resources for their professional studies years ahead of time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and vegetal materials

loans.name: Roxana Magaly

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana es una Sra. dedicada a sus hijos y al bienestar de su familia ella vive en la casa de su madre juntos a sus 3 hijos 2 mujercitas y un varón la mayor ya esta en la universidad estudiando ingeniería en sistemas , la siguiente tiene 13 años y esta en secundaria y el ultimo que es un varoncito esta en primaria , La Sra. cuenta con un vehículo propio el cual lo hace trabajar como apoyo a sus ingresos familiares además la familia vive cómodamente ella no cuenta con ninguna deuda en otra institución el crédito que ella esta necesitando es para la compra de una Batería para el vehículo. Ella llego a nosotros por recomendación de su cuñada que es una buena clienta de EMPRENDER.
texts.en:
Sra. Roxana is a woman who is dedicated to her children and the welfare of her family. She lives at her mother’s house with her three children, two daughters and a grown son who is at the university studying systems engineering. Her middle child is a 13 year old high school student while her youngest is in elementary school.

Sra. Roxana has her own vehicle that she uses for work to support her family’s income. Her family lives comfortably and she does not have any debts with other credit institutions. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a battery for her vehicle. Roxana was recommended by her sister-in-law, who is also an excellent client of Emprender.

loans.use: Purchase a battery for her vehicle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Elizabeth tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Elizabeth se dedica a la siembra de cereales.
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua y solicita un préstamo de 1250 soles para el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has three children who are in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. Elizabeth engages in her business every day, but she also spends time growing grain.

Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Qaytu”, which means “Thread of Gold” in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 1250 PEN in order to pay her workers. Her dreams include seeing her children finish their studies and expanding her business.

loans.use: Pay her workers

loans.name: Cherry Lyn's Group

texts.en: Cherry Lyn P. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Blueberry. Cherry Lyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Lyn owns and operates a handicraft business selling specialty handicrafts like souvenirs, wallets, hats, place mats and handkerchiefs to tourists and local community members. Cherry Lyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Cherry Lyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Lyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherry Lyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional specialty handicrafts

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
Leoncia es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Leoncia es viuda tiene 6 hijos y solo uno de ellos vive con ella, Leoncia viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende pescado, carne, verduras y de la Selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Leoncia solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de verduras.
Leoncia sueña con hacer su casa de material noble y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leonicia is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Qaytu”, which means “Thread of Gold” in Quechua. She is widowed and has six children, but only one of them still lives with her. Leonica travels to the jungle in Ayacucho to sell fish, meat, and vegetables. While she is there, she buys fruits to sell later at the supply market.

Leonicia is requesting a loan of 900 PEN in order to buy vegetables. Her dreams include building a house made of solid materials and providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Tania Margoth

texts.es:
Tania es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Tania junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánica en un local alquilado, además Tania tiene una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, además Tania vende ropa a pedido.
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua y solicita un crédito de 1750 para la compra de chompas, pantalones.
El sueño de Tania son tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Tania is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She and her husband manage an auto repair shop from a rented location. In addition, Tania also sells spare parts at their store. She also sells clothing upon request.

Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Qaytu”, which means “Thread of Gold” in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 1750 PEN in order to buy sweaters and trousers. Her dream is to open a clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase sweaters & trousers

loans.name: Rio De Oro Group

texts.es:
El Banco Río D. Oro inicia su quinto ciclo con 18 socias.
Haydee es tesorera D. su Banco Comunal Por primera vez, llego a ser socia por invitación D. sus amigas para ahorrar porque en casa no se pueD..
Haydee tiene 37, es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 9 y 4 años, Haydee brinda servicios D. bordado en correas, bolsas para una empresa, además trabaja realizando limpieza en una oficina por las mañanas. El esposo D. Haydee es albañil y realiza trabajos por contratos.
Haydee solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles para L. compra D. herramientas D. albañilería.
Haydee sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Río D. Oro” (River of Gold) is starting its fifth loan cycle with 18 members.

Haydee is serving for the first time as the Communal Bank treasurer. She became a member after being invited by her friends because she wanted to save but was not able to do so at home. Haydee is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 9 and 4). She offers her services to a company by producing embroidered belts and purses. Haydee also has a morning job in which she cleans an office. Her husband is a mason and works on contract jobs.

She is requesting a loan of 300 PEN to buy masonry tools. Haydee dreams of opening a grocery store and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase masonry tools

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita C. lives in the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ.. She is 30 years old, married, has two young children and makes a living by selling food items such as eggs, drinks and juice to people in her community. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Rita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 15,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards.  

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: María Angelica

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

Para la señora María este es su segundo ciclo con el Banco Comunal y esta muy a gusto y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que reciben para impulsar su negocio. Tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual procreo dos hijos, una ya es mayor de edad que ya está casada, el menor de sus hijos vive con ella,  su marido es mecánico. Ella estudia diseño de modas en el Instituto Tecnológico De Diseño (SMOD).

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, elabora toda clase de vestidos desde trajes de novias, quinceañeras hasta trajes casuales aunque siempre dice que a ella le gusta inventar los diseños, trabaja todas las tardes hasta la noche ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a estudiar, dice que cuando tiene mucho trabajo necesita de ayudantes para terminar a tiempo.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar telas y otros artículos para la confeccion de ropa, su meta es llegar a ser una gran diseñadora de modas.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank Su Bankito meets in the neighborhood of La California in the city of Portoviejo, known as la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos. 

This is María's second loan with the communal bank and she's very grateful to the Fundación Espoir for the help they've given her in building her business. She's 44-years-old and she lives in a common law marriage with the father of her two children. Her daughter is grown and married, her son lives with her, and her husband is a mechanic. She studied fashion design at the Instituto Tecnológico de Diseño (SMOD).

She has a sewing shop in her house where she makes all types of clothing from wedding and quinceañera gowns to casual wear. She always says that she likes to create her own designs. She works every afternoon until dark because in the mornings she has to go to school. She says that when she has lots of work she needs assistants to finish on time. 

This loan will be used to buy fabric and other items for making clothes. Her goal is to become a famous fashion designer.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Rosa es casada, tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, también brinda el servicio de fotocopias. Además Rosa trabaja preparando desayunos escolares.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Rosa sueña con que sus hijos estudien y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas” (Virgin of Cocharcas). She is married and has four children in school. Rosa has a store in her home where she sells groceries and provides photocopy services. In addition, she prepares breakfasts to sell to the school children.

Rosa needs a loan of 1050 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Her dreams include seeing her children continue their studies and opening another business.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Primero de Mayo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población de la región Lambayeque, es a su vez el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de tubérculos en un pequeño puesto situado en el exterior del mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región), ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de tubérculos al por mayor y menor como papas, camotes, yucas, etc. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto conocida y actualmente cuenta con clientela fija.

Erlita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer honesta y de buen trato, las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Erlita is a 44 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the First of May section of the José Leonardo Ortiz District, which is the largest district in Lambayeque region. This district is known for having high rates of poverty and being an area of commerce.

Erlita has been selling tubers for ten years from a small stand situated outside of the Moshoqueque Market (the regional wholesale market). She offers her customers all types of tubers in large and small amounts such as potatoes, yams, cassava, and other products. Throughout the entire time she has been in business, Erlita has become well-known and currently has an established customer base.

She wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to restock her inventory and increase her sales. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN to accomplish her goal.

Erlita is an honest woman who provides good service. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and responsible person. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that she is prompt and responsible when completing her payments.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of tubers

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es viuda y tiene un hijo, Alejandrina tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, confecciona ropa típica, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y Huanta.
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas y solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son ahorrar dinero para el futuro y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Alejandrina is a widow and she has one child. She has a sewing workshop where she makes traditional garments. She sells in the markets in Ayacucho and Huanta. Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank Virgen de Cocharcas and she's requesting a credit of 1500 soles ($550) to buy fabric. Her dream is to save money for the future and improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Victoria es casada, tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, Victoria vive en el Distrito de Acosvinchos y se dedica junto a su esposo a la fabricación de tejas, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Victoria solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de leña y pago de peones.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the communal bank Virgen de Cocharcas. She's married and has 4 school-aged children. Victoria lives in the district of Acosvinchos and works with her husband making tiles; they also sell their products in Acosvinchos. She's requesting a loan of 1050 soles ($400) to buy firewood and pay employees. Victoria's dream is that her children will finish school and she will improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood and and wages for laborers

loans.name: Georgina Aurea

texts.es:
Georgina es casada y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores, Georgina se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria con la ayuda de un triciclo. Además Georgina hace canchas de arroz que luego embolsa  y vende en las diferentes tiendas.
Georgina es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas y solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de bolsas y golosinas.
Georgina sueña con tener su capital propio para ya no solicitar prestamos.
texts.en:
Georgina is married and has six grown children.

Georgina sells sweets and drinks at the door to a school.  She does this everyday in an itinerant manner with the help of a tricycle.  Also, Georgina makes toasted corn.  She then puts the corn in bags and sells it to different stores.

Georgina is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas Communal Bank.  She is requesting a loan for 1,050 soles to buy bags and sweets.

Georgina dreams of having her own capital so that she does not need to request loans.

loans.use: To buy bags and sweets

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Garcés del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población de la región Lambayeque, es a su vez el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de frutas en el Mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado mayorista de la región) ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de frutas de estación como manzanas, mandarinas, peras, etc. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y le hace sentirse activa y útil a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con clientela fija y es conocida en el rubro.

Dina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más frutas de modo que pueda surtir su negocio con frutas de temporada como fresas y naranjas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Dina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que diariamente se esfuerza en su negocio para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Dina is a 47 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and two children in the Garcés area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It's the most populated district in the Lambayeque region. It is also the district with the highest poverty rates, and is characterized as a commercial area. 

For four years she has been selling fruit in the Moshoqueque market (the regions's wholesale market). She offers her customers every type of fruit in season such as apples, tangerines, pears, etc. The business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses and it makes her feel active and useful in her family. At present she has regular customers and she is known in the area. 

Dina wants to grow her business by buying more fruit so that she can supply her business with seasonal fruit such as strawberries and oranges. To meet her goal, she has found it in her  best interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a  loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

Dina is a very hardworking woman who works hard every day at her business to continue helping her family get ahead. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa previously and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making his payments.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in season to grow her business selling in the market.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Felicitas es casada y tiene 3 hijos estudiante, Felicitas vive en el Distrito de Acosvinchos y se dedica junto a su esposo a la fabricación de tejas, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Felicitas solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Felicitas son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the communal bank "Viren de Cocharcas."
Felicitas is married and has 3 children who are in school.  She lives in the Acosvinchos district.  She and her husband have a business where they make roof tiles; it is located in a place where they also sell their products.
Felicitas requests a loan of 1,050 Peruvian soles to buy firewood.
Felicitas dreams of providing a good education for her children, and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Kathlyn's Group

texts.en:
Kathlyn G. lives in the village of Mitacas Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 31 years old and leads a three-person loan group called Manan-aw. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Kathlyn is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by selling products people use daily, such as milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Kathlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Fernanda es casada tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 son estudiantes, Fernanda vive en el centro poblado de Pomacocha, Distrito de Vischongo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes, también vende verduras, frutas. Además Fernanda siembra hortalizas que vende en la feria de su zona.
Fernanda solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de azúcar y arroz.
Fernanda sueña con surtir su negocio y que sus hijos prosperen con los estudios.
texts.en: Fernanda is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas communal bank. She is married with 8 children, 4 of whom are in school. Fernanda lives in the village of Pomacocha, located in Vischongo district, where she has a grocery store. She also sells fruits and vegetables. In addition, Fernanda grows vegetables to sell at markets in her area. She is requesting a loan of 1,050 soles in order to buy sugar and rice. Her dream is to stock up her business and that her children do well in their studies.

loans.use: Purchase sugar and rice.

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es:
Toribia tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo a su cargo, reside junto a su hermana en el distrito de Monsefú, un distrito conocido por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas, se encuentra ubicado a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la confección, bordado y venta de todo tipo de tejidos para ferias y fiestas sociales, ella elabora estos productos en su vivienda y los ofrece en venta por pedidos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son pobladores de la zona. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad ella es conocida en el rubro y sis productos son bastante apreciados.

Actualmente Toribia cuenta con varios pedidos pendientes, como manteles y trajes para bailar marinera (danza típica del norte peruano), ella necesita adquirir material para poder cumplir con su trabajo de mejor manera, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de telas e hilos con los cuales pueda realizar sus labores.

Toribia es una mujer creativa y con mucha destreza para su oficio, su sueño es ver a su trabajo reconocido en diversos festivales y ferias de la zona. Las personas que le conoce le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Toribia is 42 years old, separated and has one child. She lives with her sister in the Monsefú district, which is known for its tourist and religious festivals and is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past three years she has been sewing, embroidering and selling all kinds of fabric for fairs and social events. She makes the products at home and sells by request to her customers, most of whom are residents of the area. Because of the time she has working in this activity, she is known in the business and her products are very popular.

Currently Toribia has a number of orders outstanding for tablecloths and outfits for the marinera dance (a typical dance from northern Peru). She needs to buy material so she can fulfill the work. For this reason she has decided to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative. The loan is for 800 new soles and she plans to buy fabric and thread with which to do her work.

Toribia is a creative woman who has a lot of skill for this type of work. Her dream is to see her work recognized at various festivals and fairs in the area. The people who know her have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread for her dressmaking and fabric business.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

La señora Luz María tiene 52  años de edad, está casada hace 30 años  y tiene 3  hijos todos mayores solo la ultima vive con ella, su esposo trabaja en la defensoría del pueblo. Estudia diseño de modas en el Instituto Tecnológico De Diseño (SMOD).

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, elabora toda clase de vestidos desde trajes de novias, quinceañeras hasta trajes casuales aunque también hace otros trabajos para instituciones que requieren de sus servicios, trabaja todas las tardes hasta la noche ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a estudiar, dice que le llega mucho trabajo por lo cual tiene dos ayudantes a las cuales les enseña su profesión y a la vez le paga un sueldo,  esto le sirve para terminar a tiempo sus obras ya que dice que la puntualidad es muy importante.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar telas y otros artículos para la confección de ropa. Para la señora Luz este es su segundo ciclo con el Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta porque le ha gustado la forma de trabajar de la institución y dice que espera estar durante muchos años mas en la Fundación Espoir.

Su meta es llegar a ser una gran diseñadora de modas y tener una gran empresa que sea reconocida a nivel internacional.
texts.en:
The "Su Bankito" communal bank meets every two week in the La California area of Portoviejo city, know as the City of the Royal Tamarindos. 

Luz María is 52 years old, married for 30 years and has 3 children. Only the youngest child lives with her. Her husband works in the town´s ombudsman´s office. She studies fashion design at the Tecnological Institute of Design (SMOD).

She has a dressmaking workshop at home and makes all kinds of dresses from wedding and quinceañera gowns to casual outfits. She also does work for institutions that need her services. She works every afternoon until evening, because in the mornings she has to go to school. She says she gets a lot of work, which is why she has two assistants to whom she is teaching the profession as well as paying a salary. This helps her to finish her work on time because she says that punctuality is very important.

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric and other items for making clothing. This is Luz´s second loan from the communal bank. She is very happy because she likes the way the institution operates and expects to be in Fundación Espoir for many more years.
 
Her goal is to become a great fashion designer and to have a company that is internationally recognized.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario y siempre trata de que sean de buena calidad para poder mantener a su clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades las utiliza ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer activa y de buen trato. Sus clientes le quieren y estiman mucho. Su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a su esposo para mejorar sostenidamente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 44 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband  and children in the La Matanza district, and agricultural area in the Morropón province in the Piura region. It is more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For three years she has been selling basic necessity items and groceries in a store located in her home. There she offers her customers different products for daily consumption and she always tries to make sure they are of good quality to be able to keep her customers' loyalty. The income she receives from these activities she uses to help her husband with the family expenses.  

Rosa wants to grow her business by purchasing more products so that increase her sales and have more earnings. For that she has decided it is in her best interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of  1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa is an active woman who treats people well. Her customers love and esteem her a lot. Her greatest wish is to continue supporting her husband to improve, in a sustainable way, her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase basic necessity items and groceries to grow her sales business in her home.

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón, la zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a labores asociadas a la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con una plantación de plátanos en un terreno situado cerca de la zona, el trata de otorgar el mayor cuidado a los racimos para que puedan desarrollarse de una mejor manera ya que de su venta depende el sostenimiento de su familia.

Encarnación desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo comprando algunos fertilizantes y algunas medicinas que prevengan la presencia de plagas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante conocedora del manejo de este cultivo. Su mayor anhelo es mantener a su plantación sana para que pueda brindarle una buena producción y pueda ayudarse de ella para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a 41-year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Laynas sector of the district of La Matanza.  This is an agricultural zone in the Morropón province, which is located in the Piura section of the country.  It is more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, he has dedicated himself to activities related to farming.  Currently, he has a banana crop planted on some land near this zone.  He tries to give great care to the growing bunches so they can develop better, as his ability to support his family depends on selling his product.

Encarnación would like to better maintain his plantings by buying some fertilizers and treatments to prevent the presence of plagues.  In order to meet his objective, he has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a very knowledgeable person with regard to farming.  His greatest wish is to keep his crops healthy so his land can yield a good amount of product, which will help him get his family ahead.  He has previously had loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is punctual and responsible at the moment of assuming his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and treatments to maintain his banana crop.

loans.name: Manan-Aw Group

texts.en:
Emmylou V. lives in the village of Mitacas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and leads a three-person loan group called Manan-aw. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Emmylou is married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by running a specialized store where she buys and sells dried fish, dry goods and beverages. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Emmylou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and other items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hugo Arnulfo

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Pueblo Nuevo del distrito de Buenos Aires, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente cacao y banano orgánico, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al comercio de artículos de uso doméstico como baldes, tinas y diversos recipientes de plástico, asi como también artículos para cocina hechos de acero y losa. El ofrece sus productos tanto al crédito como al contado en un pequeño establecimiento ubicado en su vivienda. Adicionalmente vende prendas de vestir por pedidos. Con los ingresos que le generan estas actividades el se encarga de mantener la economía de su familia.

Hugo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Hugo es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 47-year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Pueblo Nuevo sector of the district of Buenos Aires.  This is an agricultural zone that produces primarily cacao and organic bananas, located in the Morropón province.  It is in the Piura section of the country, which is more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has dedicated himself for four years to selling domestic products such as buckets, tubs, and a variety of plastic containers.  In addition, he sells kitchen products made from stainless steel and flagstone.  He offers his merchandise both on credit and in cash, out of a small establishment located in his own home.  He also sells clothing on request.  With the income he generates through these activities, he supports his family financially.

Hugo wishes to expand his business by buying more products, as this will allow him to grow sales and therefore increase his income.  In order to reach his goal, he has requested a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

As the head of the household, Hugo is very devoted to his family.  Each and every day, he gives his all to help them get ahead.  People that know him consider him a calm and trustworthy man.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand his business, which he has installed in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products of basic necessity, and to expand the store she installed in her home.

loans.name: Vinicio Ruperto

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

El señor Vinicio tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos,  dos mayores de edad y dos menores,  sus tres hijas estudian,  el varón trabaja y es independiente, su esposa es Abogada.

Es chofer y comerciante,  vende muchas veces con su esposa ropa por catalogo, zapatos y carteras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 17h00,  sale a recorrer con  sus productos en su carro,  entrega en Portoviejo y otros lugares cercanos. Sus productos los deja a crédito a clientes que son confiables y si no al contado, compra sus productos en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja dos veces por mes para surtirse de mercadería.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar mercadería. Este es su segundo ciclo con el Banco Comunal y está muy a gusto por los beneficios que ha recibido.
 
Su meta es comprar un carro nuevo ya que el que tiene esta un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Su Bankito" meets every 15 days.

Vinicio is 46 years old.  He is married and has 4 children: 2 of them are grown and the other 2 are minors; his 3 daughters are in school while his son works and is independent, and he is married to a lawyer.

Vinicio is a driver and a merchant, and he often works with his wife, selling clothing through a catalog as well as shoes and handbags.  He works every day from 8am until 5pm.  He goes out around the city with his products in his car, delivering them in Portoviejo and other areas nearby.  He extends credit to the customers whom he deems reliable, and sells on a cash basis to others.  He buys his products in Guayaquil; he travels to this city twice a month to stock his business with merchandise.

He will use this loan to buy merchandise.  This is his second loan cycle with the communal bank, and he is very pleased with the benefits he has received. 

Vinicio's goal is to buy a new car, since the one he has is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosario

texts.es:
Milagros es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su eposo y a sus hijos en el sector Pueblo Nuevo del distrito de Buenos Aires, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente cacao y banano orgánico, pertenece a la provincia de Morropón y se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace dos años instaló en su vivienda un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, el servicio es usado por los jóvenes y escolares de la zona, los cuales lo utilizan principalmente para resolver sus tareas escolares y encontrar entretenimiento. Durante este tiempo su negocio se ha estado haciendo conocido y ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad lo utiliza apoyando a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.
